statement: the dolphins stadium renovation will create more than new local jobs
subject: county-budget,jobs,sports,state-budget
speaker: friends-miami-first
job: promoting approval of financing for Sun Life Stadium
justification: the mailer distributed by miami first said that the dolphins stadium renovation will create more than new local jobs the dolphins based the number on a study of a million project that concluded jobs in miami dade and broward instead they tacked on an extra jobs to the new million project and say thats conservative the key omission here is that these are jobs associated with the month stadium renovation project and include temporary positions the dolphins say that some jobs would continue but they have provided no details as to how many of those jobs would extend beyond the construction phase to get those jobs the team would receive million from the state and county over about three decades and eventually pay back about million as to whether the jobs will be local the team has set a goal to hire the vast majority of the workers from miami dade county but there is no financial penalty if they fail to do so

statement: says the state budget doubled property tax credits for seniors and middle class new jerseyans and had no tax increases for any new jersey family for the second year in a row
subject: state-budget,state-finances,taxes
speaker: chris-christie
justification: the governors right about the property tax credits being doubled even though theyll remain below the fiscal average but three tax credit programs were reduced in fiscal and several experts said at least one of those reductions could represent a tax hike

statement: in june we actually had more people go on social security disability than the jobs that were created
subject: economy,jobs,social-security
speaker: allen-west
justification: rep allen west said that the number of people who became recipients of social security disability in june was higher than the number of jobs created that month west quoted the numbers accurately

statement: between june and july cnn interviewed israeli public officials versus onepalestinian official
subject: foreign-policy,israel
speaker: rula-jebreal
justification: jebreal said on cnn this time around you have between june and july you had israeli public officials vs one palestinian public official she is referencing a preliminary tally of israeli and palestinian officials voices during that time by a pro palestinian media watcher our tally confirms there was a disparity but it was not quite as lopsided as jebreal said we found appearances by israeli public officials on cnn compared to appearances by palestinian officials also the tally is measuring appearances not the numberof officials from each side who appeared and it sworth noting that any look at the media coverage is incomplete because the story is continuing to unfold

statement: the poverty rates in america today arent much better than when we started the war on poverty
subject: poverty
speaker: paul-ryan
justification: our rating ryan said the poverty rates in america today arent much better than when we started the war on poverty the official poverty rate has dropped from percent in to about percent today another measure the supplemental poverty rate suggests the rate of poverty decreased percentage points over roughly the same time period so over time living conditions have improved with government assistance but the measure of self sufficiency has been relatively stagnant

statement: says his sons were targeted on facebook by out of state protesters
subject: children,families,privacy
speaker: scott-walker
justification: state court records list kristan with wisconsin addresses dating back to and as recently as february they also show he was convicted of misdemeanor disorderly conduct after pouring a beer on state rep robin vos r rochester in a madison bar in september our rating walker said his sons were targeted on facebook by out of state protesters a protester posted two critical messages on facebook one directed at matt walker and one at alex walker but the protester is from wisconsin

statement: the republican who was just elected governor of the great state of florida paid his campaign staffers not with money but with american express gift cards
subject: campaign-finance,elections,pundits
speaker: rachel-maddow
justification: first we think many people might think maddow was referring to all campaign workers but traditional campaign staffers the people working day in and day out on the campaign were paid by check like any normal job a republican party official said it was simply an easier more efficient and quicker way to pay people and second it s not that unusual in obama did the same thing

statement: marco rubio tried to insert million for a rowing institute into the state budget
subject: message-machine,state-budget,voting-record
speaker: charlie-crist
justification: and that request as we now know wasn t made by rubio but poppell andjust to be even more clear the rowing center appropriation had its own line in the budget to tie rubio to the rowing center is an oversimplification of how the state budget process works a process crist as a former state senator knows quite well

statement: up until recently percent of all the sorties that left the base came back without dropping their ordnances because there was such a concern about making sure that there were no civilian casualties
subject: foreign-policy,military,terrorism
speaker: jeb-bush
justification: bush said up until recently percent of all the sorties that left the base came back without dropping their ordnances because there was such a concern about making sure that there were no civilian casualties that percent rate was accurate until this summer when sorties against the islamic statein iraq and syria saw an uptick so bush is right to qualify his statement experts said the obama administration did want to avoid civilian casualties but fighting an unconventional force like isis has made airstrikes more difficult than in previous conflicts analysts also noted that even at a low rate citing weapons use as an indicator of achieving strategic goals does not necessarily signify success the way bush implies

statement: there is not a single documented case of abuse of the bulk metadata collectionprogram
subject: homeland-security,terrorism
speaker: marco-rubio
justification: marco rubio said there is not a single documented case of abuse of this program rubios office did not respond to a request for comment there are plenty of documented cases of misuse of the metadata collection program it just depends whether that misuse is what you or rubio have in mind when you think of abuse we found no example of intentional misuse of the program at the least rubio should have been more clear in in his op ed to help readers understand the complexities of the metadata collection program rubios statement is partially accurate

statement: because of obamacare you have so many part time jobs
subject: health-care
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump said because of obamacare you have so many part time jobs

statement: the confederate battle flag at the south carolina statehouse must fly at a height of feet any changes taken down or even at half staff if that can be done must be passed by a supermajority of the general assembly
subject: diversity,history,states
speaker: jean-casarez
justification: a cnn reporter said by law the confederate flag at the south carolina capitol must fly at a height of feet any changes taken down or even at half staff if that can be done must be passed by a supermajority of the general assembly in south carolina passed legislation that mandated the flags location a height of feet and a supermajority vote to make any changes the confederate flag has never been removed or to our knowledge lowered since it was raised on the confederate soldiers monument on the capitol grounds

statement: every worker pays percent payroll tax
subject: new-hampshire-2012,taxes,workers
speaker: herman-cain
justification: cain said every worker pays percent payroll tax workers only pay half that with the exception of the self employed as we mentioned above the worker contribution is normally percent and thanks to the payroll tax rollback of the number this year is percent you can reach that number only by including the half of the tax that employers pay some economists say that if the employers half of payroll taxes were ended workers would see a proportional rise in wages over the long run but whatever the case cain was talking about the reality today

statement: the walton family which owns wal mart controls a fortune equal to the wealth of the bottom percent of americans combined
subject: corporations,economy,income,labor,wealth
speaker: one-wisconsin-now
justification: more americans were left with negative wealth because they lost their biggest asset their home and often significant amounts of their savings as well she said our rating one wisconsin now wrote the walton family which owns wal mart controls a fortune equal to the wealth of the bottom percent of americans combined for comparison purposes the latest data available for the figure is percent

statement: president obama pushed through the stimulus based on the promise of keeping unemployment under percent
subject: economy,jobs,stimulus
speaker: eric-cantor
justification: cantor said obamas stimulus was passed with the promise of keeping the unemployment rate below percent the majority leader says the vow was made in a january report issued by the incoming administration clearly the obama administration can be faulted for estimating the stimulus would hold unemployment just below percent

statement: ed gillespie supports a personhood amendment
subject: abortion,human-rights
speaker: mark-warner
justification: warner says gillespie supports a personhood amendment gillespie was certainly national gop chairman in when the party adopted a platform supporting a human life amendment but we havent seen any clear personal expression from his supporting such a law either then or now

statement: bill ayers and obama ran a radical education foundation together
subject: patriotism
speaker: john-mccain
justification: it unfairly tars not just obama but all the other prominent well respected chicagoans who also volunteered their time to the foundation yet in the heat of a political campaign they have been accused of financing radicalism

statement: president obama is shrinking our military
subject: federal-budget,military
speaker: mitt-romney
context: a speech in Las Vegas, Nev.
justification: romney is right that the military is shrinking partly due to a winding down of overseas wars and partly due to congressionally enacted budget limits but to say as romney did that this is being done by obama without acknowledging republican actions ignores what really happened a majority of house and senate republicans voted for the initial caps in the budget control act and the supercommittee was evenly divided between the parties meaning that its failure was bipartisan

statement: the only reason the unemployment rate is going down is because twice as many people dropped out of the employment pool as the number of jobs were created
subject: economy,jobs,workers
speaker: newt-gingrich
justification: gingrich would have been correct if hed simply challenged the white houses spin by reminding voters that the big drop in the unemployment rate came not just from the jobs created in the previous month but also from workers who left the labor force however he overplayed his hand by arguing that the only reason the unemployment rate is going down is because of labor force shrinkage it was by no means the only reason there were thousands of jobs created too we feel for him until burtless straightened us out we had thought gingrich had reported the numbers accurately using the appropriate survey data the decline in the unemployment rate stemmed in roughly equal parts from job creation and a shrinking labor force he can t put the blame only on people who stopped looking for work

statement: cap and trade legislation was originally a republican idea
subject: climate-change,environment
speaker: debbie-wasserman-schultz
context: in a question and answer after a speech
justification: wasserman schultz said that cap and trade legislation was originally a republican idea experts who have followed the history of the environmental policy focus on the fact that emissions trading to address acid rain became part of the clean air act of under bush the legislation ultimately passed with bipartisan support under a republican president more recently another prominent republican mccain co sponsored cap and trade legislation democrats did support cap and trade legislations at different points along the way but we found a strong tradition of support from republican presidents for cap and trade which uses markets to try to reduce pollution

statement: says james langevin voted to spend billion for a jet engine no one wants
subject: economy,federal-budget,government-efficiency,military,voting-record
speaker: mark-zaccaria
justification: but zaccaria went further inflating the price tag associated with the vote and asserting that no one wants it when a majority of house members were in favor of keeping it

statement: says congressman steve rothman voted against funding for president barack obamas auto bailout and would have let automakers go bankrupt
subject: economy,message-machine-2012
speaker: bill-pascrell
justification: in a news release the pascrell campaign argued that rothman voted against funding for president obama s auto industry rescue package and would have let detroit go bankrupt but at the time of that vote the program was not intended to assist the auto companies also rothman indicated a willingness to provide federal assistance for automakers through his support of a separate rescue package that was later blocked in the senate

statement: georgias high school graduation rate topped percent in
subject: education
speaker: sonny-perdue
context: speeches at schools across the state
justification: they also use old data so it s possible that fresh calculations will show a spike in rates but at this point it s doubtful they ll register a point change as georgia s leaver rate did this means that while the high graduation rate may be an encouraging sign it s not quite a cause for celebration perdue s statement is accurate but leaves out important details or takes things out of context

statement: when a bill is sent to the governors office there is no option for changing it you sign it or you dont sign it while there was lots of conversation there was really no opportunity for any sort of amending
subject: labor
speaker: patty-judge
justification: judge said theres no option for changing or amending a bill after its sent to the governors office if legislators the governors office and other interested parties had found a new consensus on the bills language sometime within that march to april window the bill could havebeen reconsidered by the senate amended returned to the house and ultimately passed in the altered form

statement: the irs is already planning on new employees to administer obamas health care mandate
subject: health-care,new-hampshire-2012
speaker: jon-huntsman
context: a Republican presidential debate in Hanover, N.H.
justification: really it was ways and means committee republicans taking only the high end of the cbo s cost predictions which floated the employee number while admitting they didnt calculate overhead costs to offset those numbers

statement: my campaign alone has created more jobs in the state of rhode island than narragansett beer
subject: Alcohol,debates,economy,jobs
speaker: clay-pell
justification: the pell campaign provided a list of campaign jobs narragansett beer said it has full time employees in rhode island part time people who work promotional events in rhode island and four full time employees out of state a major difference is that the pell jobs are short term and one way or the other most or all will be gone no later than november

statement: algeria wanted to be taken off of the terror list at the time it made an unreported donation to the clinton foundation
subject: ethics,foreign-policy,homeland-security
speaker: joe-scarborough
job: Host of a morning show on MSNBC
justification: scarborough was trying to recall the details of a news story about clinton foundation donations from foreign governments when he brought up algerias donation to the foundation to try getting off the terror list there are parts about the donations that may not look good for clinton maybe it becomes a legal problem maybe its just a political one

statement: the health care law does not demand that all of these cancellations go out
subject: health-care
speaker: nancy-pelosi
context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
justification: pelosi said the affordable care act doesnt require insurance companies to send out the cancellation notices that people have been getting the law intentionally makes it difficult for companies to avoid these minimums and the industry has responded by moving away from sub par plans pelosis statement ignores the factors in the law that push companies in a certain direction

statement: says there are a half a trillion dollars in cuts to medicare that are going to go in place as a result of health care reform
subject: health-care,medicare
speaker: jim-renacci
justification: neither a new year nor the gop takeover of the house of representatives makes it any more accurate

statement: we have the highest tax rate anywhere in the world
subject: taxes
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump while lamenting the condition of the middle class said the u s has the highest tax rate anywhere in the world statutory income tax rates in the u s fall around the end of the upper quarter of nations more exhaustive measures which compute overall tax burden per person and as a percentage of gdp show the u s either is in the middle of the pack or on the lighter end of taxation compared with other advanced industrialized nations

statement: nevada democratic party leaders hijacked the process on the floor of the state convention ignoring the regular procedure and ramming through what they wanted to do
subject: elections
speaker: jeff-weaver
justification: sanders campaign manager jeff weaver said nevada democratic party leaders hijacked the process on the floor of the state convention ignoring the regular procedure and ramming through what they wanted to do caucuses and delegate math can be incredibly confusing and the arcane party structures dont reflect how most people assume presidential selection works but the howls of unfairness and corruption by the sanders campaign during nevadas state democratic convention cant change the simple fact that clintons supporters simply turned out in larger numbers and helped her solidify her delegate lead in nevada

statement: says that under the obama administration the debt has nearly doubled
subject: economy
speaker: mike-pence
justification: pence said that under the obama administration the debt has nearly doubled his numbers are on the mark but it is important to note that the debt cannot all be blamed on obama congress has a role in approving spending and experts told us that money needed to be spent in a free falling economy

statement: ballistic tests have confirmed that the death of at least one u s border patrol agent was caused by weapons that were part of a federal arms trafficking operation
subject: criminal-justice,guns
speaker: david-dewhurst
context: a post on his campaign website
justification: by all accounts fast and furious weapons were found at the scene of a u s agent s death dewhurst s campaign was emphatic though that ballistics tests confirmed that the weapons killed the agent we found no information indicating that s so

statement: says his plan to end the toll on ga fulfills his campaign promise to commuters
subject: transportation
speaker: nathan-deal
justification: this new plan misses the original deadline by a full two years that means ga motorists will still be paying tolls much longer than they were originally promised deal failed to meet a date of his own making but he has come up with a plan to eliminate the tolls albeit on a deadline not addressed in his original campaign promise

statement: you know when this thing first hit i signed a declaration of emergency for the six counties that were directly affected impacted in the panhandle then i extended that not long thereafter down into sarasota county
subject: oil-spill
speaker: charlie-crist
context: a speech at the Florida Association of Counties conference
justification: and he did go on to expand the emergency declaration to include more counties within a month on the other hand of the four states closest to the oil disaster florida is still the only state with a limited emergency area and unlike jindal crist did not immediately seek financial help from the federal government crist s initial emergency proclamation was timely and he did continue to expand it

statement: says mark pryor voted to give social security benefits to illegal immigrants
subject: immigration,social-security
speaker: national-republican-senatorial-committee
justification: first the provision was much more narrowly targeted than the ad suggests it addressed the treatment of past payroll taxes paid by legal social security beneficiaries who at one time had been illegal immigrants second the ad cherry picks one vote pryor cast against this provision while ignoring two separate votes he cast for the provision

statement: says the central health districts tax rate is the lowest among the largest counties in texas and it will continue to be the lowest if voters approve a proposed tax increase
subject: health-care,public-health,taxes
speaker: keep-austin-healthy-pac
context: a news article posted online Oct. 18, 2012.
justification: nathan the pac spokesman said central health has the lowest tax rate among districts in the largest texas counties and will retain that distinction if the proposition passes thats correct presuming other districts dont slash rates still central healths per person tax levy is projected to outpace those of two other districts should travis county voters approve the bump this information was missing from the spokesman s statement tax rates alone make the comparison incomplete

statement: the austin tea party and an ultra conservative millionaire are behind the campaign against the citys light rail proposition
subject: city-budget,city-government,corrections-and-updates,transportation
speaker: lloyd-doggett
job: Texas congressman in the U.S. Houst of Representatives
justification: doggett said the austin tea party and an ultra conservative millionaire are behind the campaign against the citys light rail proposition skaggs seems wealthy has supported republican candidates and is treasurer for the major group battling prop the austin tea party opposes the proposal too however the group hasnt spent a dime on the cause and doesnt appear to be a major mover in the anti prop click here for more on the six politifact ratings and how we select facts to check updated p m oct this story was amended to specify that americans for prosperity didn t bring o toole to austin contrary to what a pro proposition activist said

statement: under current u s immigration policy literally one person with a green card can in the extreme bring in more than of his relatives
subject: immigration
speaker: phil-gingrey
justification: quotas mean it can take years even decades merely processing immigration documents can take months if not years given that recent data show that the average immigrant brings in others in his lifetime gingrey could easily have remained within the bounds of accuracy by describing an extreme scenario as one where two or three dozen others followed the first immigrant within years instead he said hundreds more than extreme

statement: only colleges and universities have athletic departments with revenue exceeding expenses
subject: education,sports,state-budget
speaker: jim-moran
justification: moran said only fbs schools generate more money from athletics than they spend

statement: the city of charlotte passed a bathroom ordinance mandate on every private sector employer in charlotte
subject: gays-and-lesbians,states
speaker: pat-mccrory
context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
justification: mccrory said the city of charlotte passed a bathroom ordinance mandate on every private sector employer in charlotte the ordinance would have applied to place of public accommodation like hotels and stores and other places selling goods and services to the public while that is a big category the ordinance would not have applied to private clubs nonprofits or organizations with viewpoints that would have been at odds with the law nor would have it really impacted business that don t deal with customers update after we published this fact check we heard back from josh ellis mccrory s spokesman it has been updated to include his comments

statement: medicare is going broke the trust fund goes bankrupt in
subject: federal-budget,health-care,medicare,retirement,taxes
speaker: paul-ryan
justification: the trust fund goes bankrupt in the trust fund for medicare part a primarily hospitals is projected to be exhausted in but that doesnt mean the program would be bankrupt or stop operating part a would continue to receive revenue and continue to operate albeit at a reduced level if congress doesnt make any changes in medicare even though since congress has always made changes to keep the trust fund solvent meanwhile there is no projection that the other parts of medicare will run out of money

statement: the clintons foundation took millions from foreign governments including united arab emirates and saudi arabia
subject: campaign-finance,foreign-policy,campaign-advertising
speaker: american-crossroads
justification: as we noted it doesnt violate campaign rules for a nonprofit philanthropy to accept donations from foreign governments over the years the clinton foundation has taken millions of dollars from foreign governments this includes between million and million from the united arab emirates and between million and million from saudi arabia at least a portion of those donations came in after clinton left the state department and formally joined the familys foundation that had previously been in her husbands name alone

statement: rick perry was the campaign chairman for al gore at one time not too many years ago
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: ron-paul
justification: rusak wrote is years really not too many years ago when you re about to celebrate your th birthday as dr paul is next week i suppose not but in politics it s a lifetime no it was more than two decades ago for that reason we rate pauls statement mostly true

statement: my husband and i have never gotten a penny of money from the farm
subject: campaign-finance
speaker: michele-bachmann
justification: either bachmann reported something that didn t need to be disclosed or she got money from the farm at the same time it was benefiting from crop subsidies perhaps as friedly said bachmann won t see her first penny until she draws down the assets of the limited partnership unless or until bachmann steps forward to explain the discrepancy between her financial disclosure statements and her public pronouncements we have to rely on the disclosures which say she received at least in income

statement: the health care law adds around billion of taxes on the american people it does not discriminate between rich and poor
subject: health-care
speaker: marco-rubio
justification: rubio cherry picks the highest number he can find billion in new taxes to garner opposition to the recently upheld health care law he doesnt tell readers anything more about the figure including the fact that these taxes would be garnered over years his statement also indicates that rich and poor people will feel the effects of the laws various revenue raising provisions with the same degree of pain the law taxes wealthier americans to a greater degree to provide more services for the poor

statement: says obama policies contributed to gas prices rising from in january to today
subject: economy,energy,gas-prices
speaker: roger-williams
justification: williams said obama policies caused gas prices to rise from in to today hes got the prices correct but experts say presidents dont generally have the ability to make them rise or fall and didnt see that reversing alaska gulf or keystone policies would have necessarily kept prices from rising as much but the big problem with ascribing this specific jump to obama is the failure to point out that prices collapsed right before he took office

statement: u s rep alan grayson compared a former vice president to a vampire and compared america s health care system to the holocaust
subject: health-care
speaker: republican-party-florida
justification: in our view the two uses have different meanings the world war ii holocaust conveys a deliberate horrific killing because of religion while the uncapitalized holocaust is a broader term state republicans got it right when they say grayson has compared a former vice president to a vampire but it s a stretch for their press release to liken american s health care system to the holocaust of world war ii

statement: back in the great recession when millions of jobs across america hung in the balance donald trump said rescuing the auto industry didnt really matter very much he said and i quote again let it go
subject: bankruptcy,candidates-biography,jobs
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: clinton said back in the great recession when millions of jobs across america hung in the balance donald trump said rescuing the auto industry didnt really matter very much he said and i quote again let it go trump is documented as saying just the opposite during the recession heregularly said the auto industry needed saving amid a low point for manufacturers in december he said the government should stand behind the auto industry percent clinton also takes the let it go quote out of context and time trump made that comment in not and he was making the point that a number of actions could have saved the auto industry one of which was let it go into bankruptcy

statement: says rep charles bass supports privatizing social security risking trillions more on wall street
subject: social-security
speaker: ann-mclane-kuster
context: a rally outside the N.H. Statehouse.
justification: to address this financial crisis facing the social security program one such idea congressman bass has supported would create a program that would allow individuals to voluntarily place a portion of their money that they currently pay as part of the payroll tax and place it into a personal account tranchemontagne wrote in an email to the telegraph saying that he supports privatizing social security is pure political rhetoric devised by democrat spin doctors to frighten seniors our ruling bass like most other congressional republicans at the time supported president bushs plan to introduce the option of private savings account into the social security equation

statement: after russia went to war with georgia in the u s sent a very strong message to vladimir putin by sending warships to the black sea and airlifting combat troops that georgia had in afghanistan back to georgia
subject: foreign-policy,history,military
speaker: karl-rove
justification: rove said that after russia went to war with georgia in the u s sent a very strong message to putin by sending warships to the black sea and airlifting the combat troops that georgia had in afghanistan back to georgia in reality the military message sent by the warship movements was deliberately fuzzed by having the vessels carry humanitarian aid meanwhile the airlift of georgian troops from iraq not afghanistan as rove had said was carefully calibrated not to deposit them where they could quickly face off against russian forces contemporary accounts and experts agree that rove was spinning what was actually a modest and nuanced military response into something more forceful

statement: a georgia religious freedom bill would help catholic institutions that under obamacare could be forced to provide abortion inducing drugs
subject: religion
speaker: joshua-mckoon
context: Talking with reporters about his bill.
justification: his bill did not make the senate calendar for monday the last day for most bills to clear at least one chamber with a serious chance of passing this session mckoon said he wants georgia to become the latest state to have a religious freedom law on the books but our fact check looked specifically at his comment that his bill would create a law that would serve as another tool in the tool kit of those who are fighting on the obamacare front catholic health institutions who are being asked to provide abortion services that sort of thing we dont see that he has made that case

statement: no one on my staff has ever been charged with a crime
subject: city-government,crime,job-accomplishments
speaker: tom-barrett
justification: our rating barrett said flatly no one on my staff has ever been charged with a crime his receptionist was charged in with battery and was convicted

statement: arizona is spending less on a per capita basis than every single state in this country in higher education
subject: education
speaker: michael-m-crow
context: front of the state Senate Appropriations Committee
justification: crow said we are now investing not just a little bit less than other places but markedly less on a per capita basis than every single state in this country in higher education arizona is not the worst theyre th for the current fiscal year in funding higher education crow said he made his comparison among conservative states but new hampshire the worst for higher education funding based on the study he cited appears to be in the middle of the political spectrum nevertheless arizona has endured the sharpest decline in state higher education funding from fiscal year to fiscal year even on a per student basis their spending dropped percent more than any other state from to

statement: for the cost of vanilla soy latte a day you can get a sweet health insurance plan to match
subject: health-care
speaker: cover-oregon
justification: the ad is aimed at millennials and the ones who see it are likely to know their way around a fancy cup of coffee well enough to get the comparison to insurance coverage in addition one third of the plans with published rates on cover oregon offer coverage to this group for less than the cost of a vanilla soy latte but words matter and the ads message wouldnt be accurate for many most older people will need to shell out considerably more than a day to buy insurance through cover oregon

statement: rep frank wolf voted to allow terror suspects to buy guns
subject: guns,terrorism
speaker: mayors-against-illegal-guns
justification: theres no doubt that wolf sitting in the house appropriations committee voted against an amendments to budget bills that would have allowed the attorney general to deny firearm sales to those suspected of abetting terrorism wolf had concerns that the legislation could trample the civil liberties of innocent people and objected to the procedure of bypassing judiciary committee a panel that has quashed similar bills since mayors against illegal guns goes a step further in saying wolf voted to allow terror suspects to buy guns thats an inflammatory statement that suggests wolf put gun rights ahead of protecting the nation from terrorists it ignores wolfs spurned offer in to work with the sponsor of the amendment to find a compromise that could keep guns away from suspected terrorists while protecting the rights of those who have been unfairly placed on the governments watch list so the mayors statement has accuracy but omits important details about wolfs position

statement: says donald trump has the gall to say that prisoners of war like john mccain arent heroes
subject: military,veterans
speaker: hillary-clinton
context: a national security speech in California
justification: clinton accused trump in a speech thursday of having the gall to say that prisoners of war like john mccain arent heroes in one sense she has a point trump did in fact say that john mccain is not a hero despite his pow record although trump has since taken those comments back and called mccain a hero however clintons speech was intended to more broadly attack trumps national security credentials yet trump has never made the general statement that pows are not heroes even if his mccain specific comments did insinuate it in fact he has insisted to the contrary on multiple occasions

statement: this is the first time in our state and one of the first times in the country where benefit reductions has happened to people who are retired
subject: bankruptcy,deficit,economy,labor,legal-issues,pensions,public-service,retirement,state-budget,state-finances,states,taxes,unions,workers
speaker: george-nee
job: President of the Rhode Island AFL-CIO
justification: nee referring to the current proposal to scale back pension benefits said this is the first time in our state and one of the first times in the country where benefit reductions have happened to people who are retired well give him a pass on the glaring exception of central falls since he was talking about state plans nor is it one of the first times for state plans in the united states seven states percent have already done it but nee was correct in noting that previous pension changes had no effect on the people who already had retired at the time get updates from politifactri on twitter to comment or offer your ruling visit us on our politifact rhode island facebook page

subject: criminal-justice

justification: jolly said crist stood there over three african american prisoners in chains on their knees on the side of the road saying that it was a great sight saying we needed to bring it to florida and you did this whether you know or not on the eve of juneteenth the day the african american community celebrates the end of slavery jolly missed the mark on the finer points of the visit and the photograph crist went to alabama to observe chain gangs in action more than a week prior to juneteenth he also didnt say it was a great sight although he expressed his approval of the practice he also wanted to bring the same style of chain gangs to florida which had just passed a law allowing it the department of corrections only implemented individual leg irons later that year the statement is partially accurate but leaves out important details

statement: three thousand felons voted in rhode island in
subject: civil-rights,criminal-justice,elections,public-safety
speaker: carolyn-medeiros
job: Executive director, Alliance for Safe Communities
justification: medeiros said felons voted in rhode island in she accurately cited a number compiled by opendoors which helps released inmates register and kept track of how many voted in note in the beginning of her talk show appearance medeiros said there were re enfranchised voters that have begun voting since the election mixing the numbers of felons eligible to register to vote with those who actually voted but as she worked through her presentation she cited the correct number to suggest a statement for fact checking e mail us at politifact providencejournal com follow us on twitter politifactri

statement: the health care price tag for childhood obesity in georgia is billion annually and rising
subject: public-health
speaker: nathan-deal
justification: his overall point is accurate robinson added obesity comes at a high cost to our state and governor deal wants to give children a chance to learn about healthy living and engage in healthy living practices the billion estimate was used by various georgia news organizations and mentioned to students we appreciate the efforts of the governors office to clarify the estimate

statement: says congressman jon runyan has a plan to raise medicare costs a year
subject: health-care,medicare,message-machine-2012
speaker: shelley-adler
justification: but that figure is based on an old version of the medicare reform plan and does not account for changes made in the latest proposal also that estimate does not apply to current beneficiaries who could remain in the existing program

statement: there currently are student stations sitting empty across florida in every district and at every grade level
subject: children,education,florida-amendments
speaker: yes-8
justification: second the way the statement is written literally suggests that each school district has empty seats common sense tells you that would be impossible so we think it was just poor word choice not an intentional exaggeration still the number we re ruling on is close enough

statement: says streetcars carry more people than buses you attract more riders who dont ride transit now and actually the operating costs are not any greater than the bus
subject: transportation
speaker: charlie-hales
justification: hales said streetcars carry more people than buses you attract more riders who don t ride transit now and actually the operating costs are not any greater than the bus whether these arguments make a persuasive case for the necessity and usefulness of a streetcar system is of course up for debate the statement itself remains factual while theres some missing context its nothing significant

statement: percent of all new income today is going to the top percent
subject: income,wealth
speaker: bernie-s
justification: sanders said that percent of all new income is going to the top percent sanders is referring to pre tax pre transfer income growth during the economic recovery from we found consensus among economists that the statistic and calculation offered by sanders is credible but its just not the only way to consider income inequality other measures may be equally valid and produce different results but economists say specific data does not yet exist

statement: we have a higher rate of tested lead in people in cleveland than in flint
subject: environment,public-health
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: clinton said we have a higher rate of tested lead in people in cleveland than in flint in flint percent of all kids and percent of kids in high risk areas in flint tested positive for lead poisoning in in cleveland that rate was percent in however the lead in cleveland came from paint not water and clinton s initialphrasing made that unclear

statement: percent of federal inmates are noncitizens
subject: immigration
speaker: larry-oconnor
context: an interview on "The Real Story with Gretchen Carlson" on Fox News
justification: oconnor said percent of federal inmates are noncitizens according to the bureau of prisons thats pretty much spot on but its important to know that a hefty fraction of those inmates are only in prison for violating immigration laws and are in facilities more or less created to house them if you take those people out of the equation youre looking at about percent of federal inmates

statement: i have the most grammys of anyone my age but i havent won one against a white person
subject: pop-culture
speaker: kanye-west
justification: one other individual artist alison krauss has tied this feat he has beaten white artists in album and song categories

statement: reporters rehearse questions with white house press secretary
subject: pundits
speaker: drudge-report
justification: but the drudge report did all it could to make the statement go viral accountability applies as much to spreading information especially for a website as popular as the drudge report as it does to the journalist who wrote the article she was considering asking a question about a local issue and wanted to know if it would be appropriate to ask at the regular press briefing she opted to save the question for her interview with obama according to carney and the reporters whom he faces daily this scenario in no way matches up with their experiences halper took a shaky report and drew a strong conclusion without proof

statement: governor deal has increased education spending every year hes been in office
subject: education
speaker: brian-robinson
justification: but theres some context missing here there have been continued austerity cuts and some would say theres little or no increase once you factor in inflation

statement: from obama s book i found a solace in nursing a pervasive sense of grievance and animosity against my mother s race
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: chain-email
justification: and yet at least through age when he wrote dreams from my father he found solace in nursing a pervasive sense of grievance and animosity against his mother s race but those are sailer s words not obama s it s an arguable point whether it s a fair characterization of the views expressed in obama s book the bottom line is an e mailer somewhere took the sentence rewrote it and passed it off as obama s words

statement: donald trump called the military that i served in a disaster
subject: military
speaker: john-hutson
context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia
justification: trump called the military that i served in a disaster trump did say that almost verbatim but its worth noting that hutson has described trumps words as a personal affront to the institution he devoted his career to drawing the most unflattering interpretation for a statement that is far less specific

statement: says sen elizabeth warren lives in a million mansion
subject: candidates-biography,housing
speaker: facebook-posts
justification: the social media meme said warren lives in a million mansion warren does live in a desirable neighborhood in an expensive urban center which means that her house is much more expensive than that of most americans still the meme overshoots the facts of the case the houses estimated value is less than half of the stated million and calling it a mansion is a stretch

statement: the obama administration just issued instructions that terrorism training should not involve any reference to islam
subject: homeland-security,islam,new-hampshire-2012,religion
speaker: newt-gingrich
context: a foreign policy debate with Jon Huntsman in Manchester, N.H., Dec. 12, 2011
justification: more often the december plan issued by the white house uses language like community resilience programming and the importance of enhancing engagement with and support to local communities that may be targeted by violent extremists without explicitly saying that many of those communities are in fact muslim american the ruling there is no question that the obama administration has tried to address islam carefully and to avoid blaming a religion with an estimated billion adherents for terrorism but we find gingrich has greatly exaggerated what the obama administration has done although the justice department clearly has yanked some questionable material related to islam and the recent white house document refers almost obliquely to muslim americans it has not banned a discussion of al qaida or islam in terrorism training

statement: percent of all americans do not want to see planned parenthood defunded
subject: abortion,federal-budget,health-care,polls,public-health,women
speaker: gwen-moore
justification: she said although it isn t clear how much attention americans are paying to the videos controversy the available polling data suggests most support continued funding our rating moore said percent of all americans do not want to see planned parenthood defunded three national polls put the support at percent or higher two others show support of less than percent but taken together the average support among the five polls is nearly percent

statement: says unemployment in trenton is twice as much as what we see in every other area of the state and as a result we have seen an increase in crime
subject: crime,jobs
speaker: shirley-turner
context: a speech on the Senate floor
justification: also studies have shown that unemployment can affect property crime but it has a reduced impact on violent crime to comment on this ruling go to nj com

statement: the bush administration had been giving auto companies billions of dollars and just asking nothing in return
subject: corporations,economy,transportation
speaker: barack-obama
justification: the march deadline for the auto companies gave obama about two months in office in which to make his own decisions about the companies obama said at the town hall meeting that the previous administration had been helping the auto companies giving them billions of dollars and just asking nothing in return the historical record indicates that the bush administration did ask for things in return and even gave the obama administration the power to recall the loans if the terms weren t meant

statement: clayton county public schools recently achieved a milestone that has eluded other metropolitan districts across the state by meeting federal guidelines for having a highly qualified staff
subject: education
speaker: clayton-county-schools
justification: waller said he was aware that there have been other districts that have met the guidelines it was not intended to imply no one else has done this he said clayton did meet the percent threshold for this school year as the press release said there are other metro districts that have come very very close but have not reached that mark yet

statement: i took the state of ohio from an billion hole to a billion surplus
subject: economy,state-budget
speaker: john-kasich
job: Governor of Ohio as of Jan. 10, 2011
context: comments at a GOP debate in Cleveland
justification: kasich said i took the state of ohio from an billion hole to a billion surplus its possible to argue over whether the initial amount should be billion rather than billion but kasich didnt pull that figure out of thin air and it certainly was high by historical standards he also used the term hole which is more appropriate than deficit would have been meanwhile the billion figure seems solid still its worth noting that kasich spoke a little grandly when he said that i did it since the states fiscal improvement got a big assist from the national economic recovery

statement: for thousands of public employees wisconsin gov scott walkers budget repair bill would take away any say they have in the workplace and eliminate their union
subject: labor,state-budget
speaker: afl-cio
justification: the fourth felt it was only a small stretch thats what this ad does

statement: says charlotte nash pretends to be a chicken farmer in order to get property tax exemptions
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: larry-gause
justification: the assessors office was unable by thursday to share the original exemption paperwork with us gauses real point is whether nash actually deserves the agricultural exemption

statement: on birthright citizenship for illegal immigrants
subject: immigration
speaker: harry-reid
justification: nobody not even reid himself is denying that reid switched his position on clarifying the th amendment he wrote a bill in that would have denied birthright citizenship to children of illegal aliens granted he apparently regrets introducing the bill but we wanted to know whether reid has changed his position

statement: republican candidate for governor ken block was fined and had to admit that he funneled money illegally to the moderate party
subject: campaign-finance,candidates-biography,history
speaker: allan-fung
justification: fung during the debate didn t go into details he simply said that block was fined and had to admit that he funneled money illegally to the moderate party

statement: the new atlanta braves stadium will require no tax increase for homeowners and provide million annually for cobb county schools
subject: sports,taxes
speaker: revitalize-cobb
justification: the projected million increase for schools is difficult to predict and depends on many factors all lining up the tax increase angle is more clear cut a homeowners overall property tax rate may be the same as it is now but a reasonable person may consider the braves deal a tax increase over the amount he or she would have paid if the team had stayed in downtown atlanta

statement: but it was hillary clinton in an interview with tom brokaw who quote paid tribute to ronald reagan s economic and foreign policy
subject: history
speaker: barack-obama
context: a radio ad in South Carolina
justification: in who would have imagined that the hillary rodham on the wellesley commencement stage would find herself years later paying tribute to ronald reagan compare that text with obama s ad and you ll see that clinton didn t offer overall praise for reagan s economic record in fact what she did was single out what she saw as his appreciation for the challenges of the working class and his willingness to reverse course when taxes were cut too much

statement: hostages were released as soon as ronald reagan took office because iran perceived that america was no longer under the command of someone weak
subject: foreign-policy
speaker: marco-rubio
justification: rubio said that iranian hostages were released in as reagan took office because iran perceived that america was no longer under the command of someone weak in reality reagans foreign policy approach wasnt a factor in the hostages release as scholars told us the carter administration negotiated the deal months before reagans inauguration without involvement by reagan or his transition team

statement: a photo from the russia finland hockey game shows a sad vladimir putin and dmitry medvedev
subject: sports
speaker: tweets
justification: a photo making the rounds on twitter shows a sad looking vladimir putin and dmitry medvedev allegedly after russias tournament ending hockey loss to finland but it was taken days earlier during a russian victory against slovakia we re guessing putin and medvedev are sad that their team lost but the photo circulating on the internet does not actually depict that

statement: in a full time worker earning minimum wage could actually support a family of three above the poverty line today that same worker would earn less than the poverty line for a family of two
subject: families,poverty,workers
speaker: virginia-interfaith-center-public-policy
justification: the wage was bifurcated then clearly the buying power of the minimum wage has decreased in recent decades the center tried to illustrate that point with a statement that is accurate but needs a little clarification

statement: republican gubernatorial candidate eric greitens spent another on image consultants to rebrand his charity the mission continues
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: chris-koster
justification: in a tv ad koster said greitens charity the mission continues spent on image consultants this amount was well supported by non profit form s which listed in payment to pr firm fleishmanhillard furthermore it implied that a charity spending money on branding is wasteful an expert who monitors charities said it was a legitimate expense

statement: says his much discussed boots are made in wisconsin
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: marco-rubio
context: an exchange with voters at an Iowa campaign event
justification: rubio said his much discussed boots are made in wisconsin his florsheim ankle boots arent made in the badger state where the company is headquartered florsheim told us most of their products are made in china but rubios boots came from india we have to put our foot down on this one

statement: says u s sen ron johnson doesnt even believe that theres a man made role in climate change
subject: environment
speaker: russ-feingold
context: a meeting with the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel editorial board.
justification: our rating feingold said johnson doesn t even believe that there s a man made role in climate change johnson did not support a senate amendment to acknowledge a man made role in climate change and expressed skepticism each of the few times he acknowledged humans might contribute he has acknowledged at times that humans can play a role but downplayed how significant that role might be

statement: bill nelson was the deciding vote on the health care law
subject: health-care,message-machine-2012,voting-record
speaker: american-commitment
justification: american commitment says that florida sen bill nelson cast the deciding vote for health care the health care law required votes so nelson s vote was crucial as were the other votes but describing nelson as the deciding vote suggests he had some extraordinarily powerful role and thats not the case nelson had cautiously been a supporter for months as he tried to amend the law

statement: veterans can now download their electronic medical records with a click of the mouse
subject: health-care,technology,veterans
speaker: barack-obama
context: his State of the Union address
justification: in fact most of the information now available to vets is information they self entered vets can t yet get a lot of medical records though the blue button though more and more information is being added in the near future

statement: fox news barely covered the duggar family scandal until megyn kelly was able to secure this interview
subject: pop-culture,pundits
speaker: brian-stelter
justification: stelter said fox news barely covered this scandal until megyn kelly was able to secure this interview our review of media mentions of the duggar story among cnn msnbc and fox supports his statement fox news coverage was fleeting before kellys interview was announced

statement: china is in the south china sea and building a military fortress the likes of which perhaps the world has not seen
subject: china,foreign-policy,military
speaker: donald-trump
context: an interview with the New York Times
justification: trump said china is in the south china sea and building a military fortress the likes of which perhaps the world has not seen china made large land grabs in the south china sea and has constructed several artificial islands in the region however it sa stretch for trump to say these outposts that could be used for military purposesamount to a fortress

statement: during my eight years as county executive we cut the number of county workers by percent
subject: county-budget,county-government,unions
speaker: scott-walker
justification: but because the workers didnt become state employees until the reduction does not affect the employee tally during walkers county time which ended in december our rating first time author scott walker wrote that during my eight years as county executive we cut the number of county workers by percent the governors memory is correct

statement: bill nelson voted for billions in wasteful spending earmarks like the bridge to nowhere
subject: federal-budget,transportation
speaker: george-lemieux
justification: i wouldn t put him in the pantheon of earmarkers but he certainly played the game but this ad paints with a broader brush criticizing nelson for voting for billions of dollars worth of earmarks such as the bridge to nowhere nelson may not have specifically supported the bridge to nowhere project but there s no question he voted in favor of a bill that was known to include billions of dollars worth of road project earmarks some of which nelson had requested for florida

statement: under president barack obamas leadership since june the auto industry has added a quarter of a million jobs
subject: jobs
speaker: bob-king
context: a speech to the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.
justification: the data will change once new jobs figures are released on sept but at the time king made the statement his data was correct

statement: jobs incentive program created over high wage jobs since
subject: county-budget,economy
speaker: tammy-hall
justification: i think the message is that we are out there doing our part as government to allow those jobs to accumulate she said does first initiative economic incentive program created over high wage jobs since accurately convey that message and the facts the number of jobs created is overstated by about percent and most remain unfilled now also the first initiative program isnt the only source of incentive money being used

statement: my opponent lost jobs in houston since he took over we are losing jobs
subject: economy
speaker: farouk-shami
justification: first he distorted unemployment in the houston area but the number of unemployed people doesn t translate to the number of jobs lost in houston second shami chose not to factor in the share of harris county residents who were employed which increased during white s tenure

statement: a recent study found that cities where uber operates have fewer drunk driving deaths than cities without access to ridesharing
subject: economy,transportation
speaker: uber
context: an online petition and in a press release
justification: but the study looked only at california cities two national studies found the service had no effect on drunken driving deaths

statement: more businesses are closing than are opening for the first time in our nations history
subject: economy
speaker: todd-wilcox
justification: wilcox said more businesses are closing than are opening for the first time in our nation s history hes right that more firms are now closing up shop than starting up a trend that started in but the stat hes citing is from a study of a year period from to not all of american history the census bureau database used for that study has only been measuring entries and exits since the s economists including the studys author told us wilcox overreached a bit because this trend may have happened before there are no dependable sources of information to prove this is the first time this has occurred the statement is partially accurate but leaves out important details or takes things out of context

statement: foster children are disproportionately victims of identity theft
subject: children,consumer-safety,crime,families,financial-regulation
speaker: james-langevin
justification: clearly identity theft is a big problem that often isn t recognized among children requiring the state to clear a foster child s credit history before he or she graduates from state custody seems like a good policy representative langevin said foster children are disproportionately victims of identity theft the concept is apparently widely believed and asserted among child advocates but no study has directly compared identity theft rates between foster children and other children the california study is the only one to look at identity theft among foster children and it found a rate of roughly percent of the two studies we found that looked at overall childhood rates one showed a rate of identity theft that was similar to foster children the second found a rate that was higher than the rate seen in the study of foster children get updates from politifactri on twitter

statement: full marriage equality would provide same sex couples with about rights
subject: civil-rights,gays-and-lesbians,marriage
speaker: bill-fischer
job: lobbyist and spokesman for Marriage Equality Rhode Island
justification: but when numbers like these are thrown around we expect advocates to have more to back them up than a rudimentary word search that fails to say what right or benefit might be at stake

statement: obama says his bill reduced welfare rolls nearly percent
subject: poverty
speaker: barack-obama
justification: but lewis said he did not disagree with bouman s estimate gary macdougal former chairman of the illlinois republican party and the chairman of the illinois governor s task force for human services reform downplays obama s role in the bill and agreed with bouman that there were other significant factors in the decline besides the state law he said the most important factor was the governor s reorganization of state agencies and he said the booming economy of the s was also very helpful in the decline so the obama ad is right about the size of the decline but is reaching too far by taking credit for it

statement: reporters have uncovered another scott company accused of criminal acts but scott wont come clean
subject: candidates-biography,crime,message-machine
speaker: florida-first-initiative
justification: the case was a civil one not criminal and scott provided a deposition as required the only instance of him failing to come clean is not providing the results of that deposition to the public which he doesn t have to

statement: the seed of muslim is passed through the father
subject: religion
speaker: franklin-graham
justification: in fact the vast majority of sources said that religious faith was based on the affirmation of islamic beliefs but we found a secondary definition that said people born to a muslim father and identify as cultural muslims could be considered islamic even if they don t have islamic beliefs though that was considered controversial

statement: the number of swat raids have gone up by percent since the s
subject: crime,criminal-justice,drugs
speaker: john-oliver
context: a segment on his show, "Last Week Tonight"
justification: in reality we dont have a good idea of how the data stacks up today since kraskas surveys arent ongoing and because no government entity tracks swat raids systematically in a field short on comprehensive data these are the best figures available still its worth noting that the data ends in and we dont know for sure what the level is today

statement: says that under texas law it takes six years to close a failing school
subject: education
speaker: david-dewhurst
context: remarks to the Dallas Regional Chamber
justification: fourteen schools had posted more than two consecutive unacceptable years but hadnt yet reached five ratcliffe said that although a new accountability system is in the works the six year requirement wont change unless the state law governing closure is modified by the legislature for example if dewhursts two year suggestion were adopted our ruling dewhurst said it takes six years under texas law to close a failing school thats the maximum and its usually taken nearly that long but by law a commissioner can order closure after just three years

statement: the planned expansion of savannahs port is a jobs creating project
subject: jobs
speaker: nathan-deal
justification: the corps estimates that dredging the port will require additional workers although its not clear how many evidence and common sense suggest that if megaships flock to a newly deepened savannah port the project could keep jobs in georgia it may well create them but existing research offers little clarity

statement: says rick scott changed his promise from jobs created on top of what normal growth would be to just jobs
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: charlie-crist
justification: crists ad says that scott changed his promise of jobs created on top of what normal growth would be to just jobs thats a difference of million jobs as had been projected by economists the ad provides a concise but accurate summary of scotts pledge and then his public statements that modified the terms

statement: i waited until the trans pacific partnership trade agreement had actually been negotiated before deciding whether to endorse it
subject: candidates-biography,history,trade
speaker: hillary-clinton
context: comments during the New Hampshire Democratic debate
justification: clinton said i waited until the trans pacific partnership trade agreement had actually been negotiated before deciding whether to endorse it as secretary of state and a member of the obama administration it was clinton s job to promote the deal even if it wasn t finalized nonetheless her comments at the time were so positive and so definitive it becomes disingenuous to argue as she s doing now that she didn t endorse the deal before it was finalized

statement: gov romney was very clear he would veto the dream act
subject: immigration
speaker: david-plouffe
justification: romney was very clear he would veto the dream act romney did say that without equivocation during the republican primary he has not indicated a change in that position its worth pointing out though that romney does support one element of the dream act allowing young illegal immigrants who were brought to the united states as children to become permanent residents and eventually citizens by serving honorably in the united states military according to a statement from the campaign the dream act though provided a path to legal status to young people who are in school without serving in the military

statement: the wisconsin economic development corp cannot account for creating one single job
subject: jobs
speaker: chris-larson
justification: larsons correct in that the agency or a critical audit cant quantify its effectiveness but larsons statement suggests no businesses have been assisted by wedc

statement: under the clear letter of the law justice clarence thomas must recuse himself from the case challenging the constitutionality of the health care law
subject: ethics,health-care,supreme-court
speaker: anthony-weiner
justification: it is by no means clear under the letter of law that justice thomas must recuse himself in fact there is a great deal of disagreement among legal experts we spoke to that virginia thomas previous jobs meet the definition of financial interest or whether it s enough to establish that justice thomas impartiality might reasonably be questioned weiner s statement suggests the letter of the law is clear cut in backing his position and it is not even those who support weiner s position allow that it boils down to a matter of interpretation

statement: collectively states are spending more on medicaid than they do on k education
subject: education,medicaid,state-budget
speaker: eric-cantor
justification: cantor said states are spending more on medicaid than on education his statement is correct although it should be noted that a substantial portion of the dollars states are spending on medicaid come from the federal government

statement: lizbeth benacquisto broke election law times hiding special interest contributors
subject: ethics,message-machine
speaker: kevin-rader
justification: we found that of contributions to benacquisto so far this year times the occupation isnt listed according to information on the florida division of elections website in fairness well note that inraders last report for the period of sept through oct he also fails to list occupation times among the donors according to the state division of elections website florida election commission clerk patsy rushing said on oct that no complaints have been filed against benacquisto in this race well leave it up to you to determine whether theres intent to leave off contributors names or just sloppiness by the campaign

statement: every dollar we invested in high quality early education programs can save more than later on by boosting graduation rates reducing teen pregnancy even reducing crime
subject: children,education
speaker: barack-obama
justification: whether these programs are high quality is a more difficult discussion there is debate about the long term effectiveness of the perry program and of head start because there are so many factors involved in a childs development after the child leaves these programs additionally theres little research on the long term impact of these programs in georgia and oklahoma so the presidents remarks seem to be a stretch at this point

statement: recently florida has successfully reduced the environmental permitting time down to just two days
subject: environment,government-regulation,market-regulation
speaker: rick-scott
context: an event with employees from the Department of Environmental Protection
justification: scott said recently florida has successfully reduced the environmental permitting time down to just two days scott was mistaken he was actually referring to the amount of time it takes to get a professional license from the department of business and professional regulation during scotts tenure the state has reduced the amount of time it takes to get an environmental permit to about days

statement: energy nominee steven chu has called coal his worst nightmare
subject: energy
speaker: james-inhofe
justification: so if confirmed as secretary of energy i will work very hard to extensively develop these technologies so that the united states and the rest of the world can use it we watched the video and this seems like an accurate description of the context of his remarks so inhofe s nightmare comment is literally accurate but it divorces chu s words of important context still there are aspects of coal that genuinely disturb chu

statement: gov charlie crist sought for and got approved the automatic restoration of felon rights for nonviolent offenders for the first time in florida history
subject: civil-rights,crime,elections
speaker: dan-gelber
justification: gelber said that crist sought for and got approved the automatic restoration of felon rights for nonviolent offenders for the first time in florida history first a minor quibble the restoration of felon rights under crist was not automatic because the clemency board still had to sign off on it in askew and the cabinet changed the rules to allow for automatic restoration of rights for voting under askew the changes broadly applied to offenders whether they had completed sentences related to violent or nonviolent offenses crists policy favored nonviolent offenders depending on your viewpoint it was askew who earned kudos or criticism not crist for making it far easier for felons to regain civil rights including the right to vote

statement: and percent john of your ads percent of them have been negative
subject: candidates-biography
speaker: barack-obama
justification: that s far short of percent it also found percent of obamas ads have been negative thats up for both parties from the election when percent of george bushs ads were negative compared to percent of john kerrys so obama might be right for one week but he is way off for the overall campaign when mccain s negative ads accounted for percent

statement: were up jobs over the last year and three quarters were actually according to the bureau of labor statistics down auto jobs in ohio
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: john-kasich
job: Governor of Ohio as of Jan. 10, 2011
justification: parts manufacturing down jobs since kasich took office is up jobs from the trough of june it is also worth noting that the figures the governor cited reflect only direct jobs in the auto industry some industry analysts such as the center for automotive research in ann arbor also look at two other categories of employment in the industry intermediate and spin off in considering the impact auto manufacturing has on the economy under that gauge job growth in other businesses that have a connection to the auto industry also would be considered

statement: the commission form of government is definitely losing favor in the united states
subject: county-government
speaker: kimberly-nelson
justification: in fulton county leaders there have discussed elevating the commission chair s authority while making it tougher to fire the county manager state lawmakers may take up both proposals in next year s legislative session the atlanta journal constitution has reported to sum up nelson said at a dekalb county town hall meeting on the current structure of county government that the commission form of government is definitely losing favor in the united states anecdotal information and the most comprehensive report on counties support her point

statement: the company i created point judith capital is the only venture capital firm in rhode island

statement: the number of americans who receive means tested government benefits welfare now outnumbers those who are year round full time workers

statement: says he will protect your guaranteed benefits in medicare while mitt romney would take away medicare as guaranteed benefits

justification: in the ad obama said he will protect your guaranteed benefits in medicare while mitt romney would take away medicare as guaranteed benefits currently medicare does guarantee a form of health coverage for seniors and in the shorter term guarantees specific benefits but medicare doesnt cover everything and congress and the president can change what is covered and will be forced to do so when fiscal pressures hit meanwhile its plausible that the romney plan could provide less of a guarantee than medicare currently does but we found sharp disagreement between supporters and opponents of romneys medicare plan on that point this disagreement is hard to resolve given the shortage of information romney has so far provided

statement: obama biden and their liberal allies oppose clean coal
subject: energy
speaker: john-mccain
justification: if there were any doubt thatobama supports the development of clean coal plants in the united statesspecifically the energy plan on his web site makes that explicit barack obama and joe biden will develop and deploy clean coal technology carbon capture and storage technologies hold enormous potential to reduce our greenhouse gas emissions as we power our economy with domestically produced and secure energy barack obama and joe biden will instruct doe the department of energy to enter into public private partnerships to develop first of a kind commercial scale coal fired plants with carbon capture and sequestration so no obama and his liberal allies do not oppose clean coal nor does biden unless you interpret comments he made off the cuff on a rope line overly broadly and give them more credence than the energy plan he developed during his presidential campaign

statement: there have been school shootings in america since sandy hook
subject: children,education,guns
speaker: everytown-gun-safety
justification: a statistic calculated by everytown for gun safety and shared widely on social media said that there have been school shootings in america since sandy hook the groups figure is accurate only if you use a broad definition of school shooting that includes such incidents as suicides accidents and spillover from adjacent criminal activity the figure has some value in quantifying the proximity of guns to school campuses but the group makes a significant stretch by tying the statistic so closely to the mass shooting at sandy hook by doing this the group closely associates the statistic with planned mass shootings targeting students and school staff a category that using a more strict definition accounts for only of the incidents
