context: a statement on the group's Web site
justification: another floridians have signed a petition sent to gov charlie crist opposing the education proposals house speaker larry cretul s office had to add additional telephone lines to handle the flood of calls more than most of whom were from people opposing the bill said chamberlin the ocala star banner reported that means the message is getting out the state s big teachers union the florida education association said the florida house is holding the final hearing of a controversial education bill in the middle of spring break when they hope teachers are not watching or listening we find the scheduling of the hearing is much more of a practical matter than an attempt to stomp out the voice of teachers

statement: weare picking up oil with shovels and paper and plastic bags
subject: oil-spill
speaker: marco-rubio
justification: bp officials also say thick tar clogs mechanical rakes the machinery that is being used is largely out on the water in the form of skimming vessels that scoop up the thick mats of oil that have formed on the surface of the water there are currently five state leased skimming vessels working off the florida panhandle but elected officials and panhandle residents alike have complained as rubio does that more skimmers should have been deployed by bp and the federal government right after the oil rig explosion to keep oil from creeping toward the shoreline in the first place so while rubio may have been slightly off when saying paper bags were used in the clean up effort theres plenty of plastic bags and shovels being used to haul off the tar balls

statement: the milwaukee county bus system has among the highest fares in the nation

statement: president obama has raised taxes times
subject: taxes
speaker: mitt-romney
context: an e-mail to the Los Angeles Times
justification: of the provisions romney is citing we conclude that may be reasonably defined as taxes though of those only four are already in effect of the remaining six provisions romney cites we find two that are subject to disagreement and four that are probably not taxes at all so more than two thirds of the provisions romney cited are pretty clearly taxes but many of them are narrowly targeted at groups from tanning bed users to health company ceos

statement: says gm used taxpayer dollars to prop up operations in china

statement: says jonathan gruber was some adviser who never worked on our staff
subject: health-care
speaker: barack-obama
context: Brisbane, Australia, for the G20 summit
justification: obama said gruber was some adviser who never worked on our staff this carefulwording significantly downplays the mit economist s role but he was not just some adviser an especially flip characterization by hhs own documentation gruber was considered uniquely positioned for a contract job assisting with obamas health care reform efforts in that sense he was a very important adviser further while gruber never worked on our staff he was paid by the federal government quite handsomely and worked very closely with the staff his economic simulation model was very important to those writing the bill even if he wasnt the person deciding what would make the legislation and what would be left at the cutting board he also met with obama in the white house and had a dozen meetings that often included some of the most senior members of obamas economic and health care teams

statement: georgia has more than law enforcement agencies and fewer than percent of them are state certified

statement: because of the current immigration crisis republicans want to repeal a law that president george w bush signed and want to be on record as not wanting to protect children from sex trafficking

subject: debt,federal-budget,taxes

justification: our rating duffy said barack obama and hillary clinton have left us with trillion in debt the total federal debt is at trillion but most of it was amassed before obama took office and many factors congress the economy and obama himself but to almost no extent clinton played a role in the debt increases during obamas tenure

statement: says the epa outsourced the scientific basis for its greenhouse gas regulation to a scandal plagued international organization that cannot be considered objective or trustworthy
subject: energy,environment,legal-issues
speaker: greg-abbott
justification: and yes the e mails have raised questions about the work of a clutch of scientists but they have not put a significant dent in conclusions reached by the ipcc

statement: recent record low water levels in lake michigan are evidence that global warming is leading to the evaporation of our great lakes
subject: climate-change,environment,water
speaker: richard-durbin
justification: most scientists agree that recent patterns of precipitation evaporation and ice cover suggest that climate change is affecting water levels in the great lakes but over the long term dredging and erosion have lowered water levels and the sudden decline in the late s followed by a relatively stable decade and a half doesnt mesh with the presumed slow buildup of greenhouse gases in addition scientific models offer a wide range of possible impacts on water levels due to climate change from decreases to increases

statement: says gov scott walker has dropped wisconsin to th in the nation in job growth prospects while campaigning for president out of state
subject: economy,elections,job-accomplishments,jobs

justification: our rating tate said walker has dropped wisconsin to th in the nation in job growth prospects while campaigning for president out of state forbes rates wisconsin th although thats a slight improvement not a drop and walker bears some but not all of the blame for the ranking

statement: the senate health care bill is longer than tolstoy s war and peace
subject: health-care
speaker: orrin-hatch
justification: so it turns out that democrats aren t as wordy as a russian novelist

statement: in a watershed decision the warren court asserted by itself that the supreme court was supreme over the president and the congress
subject: history,legal-issues
speaker: newt-gingrich
context: an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation"
justification: in attacking the supreme court for its power relative to the other branches of government its understandable that ginrgich has zeroed in on cooper vs aaron it is an unusually strong statement of the courts primacy there was a tradition of judicial review going back to and the court had repeatedly curtailed both presidential and congressional power in the years between

statement: half the lottery directors across the country had not run a lottery before they were hired
subject: lottery
speaker: brian-robinson
justification: robinson the governors spokesman shunned criticism about the states new lottery director having no previous lottery experience when selected for the job last month robinson told a newspaper reporter that half the countrys lottery directors had not run lotteries before taking the top job there is some room for interpretation

statement: americans who get their insurance through the workplace cost savings could be as much as less per employee than if we do nothing
subject: health-care
speaker: barack-obama
justification: in short obama is citing a very speculative report that doesn t speak directly to the legislation at hand for more near term effects we think the cbo report is more definitive but the hewitt report does track a number of the provisions that were in the senate plan in november most of which are in the plan now before the house

statement: the georgia lottery corp has only once in the past years paid out the agreed upon percent of proceeds to the account which funds the hope scholarship
subject: education

justification: if mccullen had said the georgia lottery corp has not hit its target of percent since the accuracy of her statement would have hinged on what as nearly as practical means and why the legislation even included the number percent the legislators who politifact spoke with agreed that the number was included for a reason and the corporation has not come close to reaching that target in recent years but alas mccullen said that in the past years the georgia lottery corp met the percent goal only once but it has met the target three times so she has a better chance of winning the lottery than receiving a true on the truth o meter

statement: says the foreman of the jury that convicted him was a greenpeace activist
subject: bipartisanship,criminal-justice,environment
speaker: tom-delay
justification: update a m feb after we published this article stotts responded to our jan e mail seeking comment stotts replied feb i contribute monetarily to greenpeace but i am not a greenpeace activist i went to at most a few local environmental rallies because a good friend of mine used to work for their organization i have probably volunteered more times for the food bank in austin than i have for official greenpeace events

statement: on a single payer health care system
subject: health-care
speaker: barack-obama
justification: but a full examination of his comments then and now reveals they have not changed that drastically yes when he was trying to appeal to the democratic base he was a bigger supporter of the single payer plan but as we note he still says that he d prefer such a plan if he was starting from scratch so what we see here is a candidate who in was trying to appeal to a liberal electorate and today has moderated his comments to appeal to a broader national audience

statement: says that in exxonmobil paid no federal income taxes received a million rebate
subject: corporations,taxes

justification: exxonmobil says the million figure reflects holdover tax issues from previous years that showed up in paperwork for and that its u s income tax expense for was approximately million a tax professor confirmed that interpreting that million as the exxonmoblils tax figure would be a misreading of the k form

subject: job-accomplishments,jobs

justification: our conclusion in the wake of a story about poor jobs results of a state sponsored program walker sought to pin the blame on his predecessor jim doyle but he was off by five years two governors thompson and successor scott mccallum and one political party as governor doyle didnt have anything to do with approving the capco bill but as an assembly member scott walker did

statement: gop presidential hopeful herman cain called ron pauls followers ignorant
subject: campaign-advertising
speaker: ron-paul
context: the Republican presidential debate at Dartmouth College in New Hampshire
justification: but paul was very specific that one of the strong terms cain used against his backers was the word ignorant paul said hed produce proof but neither he nor his supporters have done so we couldnt find any either

statement: ralph hall has never voted to raise the debt ceiling
subject: debt,federal-budget,voting-record
speaker: cat-pac
justification: the pac said ralph hall has never voted to raise the debt ceiling we didnt have to look further than the votes cited by his opponents campaign to find six instances from through in which hall backed debt limit increases

statement: says donald trump won more counties than any candidate on our side since ronald reagan
subject: elections
speaker: mike-pence
context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
justification: pence said that trump won more counties than any candidate on our side since ronald reagan the electoral results leave little doubt that trump expanded republican success compared to romneys baseline in many corners of the country however its important not to overstate the importance of the statistic pence cited clinton may have won fewer counties overall but the ones she did win tended to be much more populous and economically dynamic

statement: says that to drive the length of the newly drawn th district youd find yourself on the road as long as it would take to drive from columbus to niagara falls

job: Chairman of the  Ohio Democratic Party
justification: lastly it needs to be said that redferns route is not the way that stivers or anyone would travel from one part of the district to another rather they would choose a direct route that crosses district boundaries and would be a much shorter drive thats a point that provides clarification

statement: there is not a single candidate in the republican primary that thinks we should do anything about climate change
subject: climate-change
speaker: barack-obama
justification: obama said there is not a single candidate in the republican primary that thinks we should do anything about climate change none of the remaining republican presidential candidates have laid out a specific plan to address climate change all of them call for scaling back obamas environmental regulations to boot some have called for private sector development of renewable energy sources bush who was in the race when obama made his comment and kasich both have said they believe human caused climate change is real and have said pursuing these alternative energy sources could mitigate the problem but neither has outlined a specific plan for some republican voters this stance might be a plus but it doesnt change the veracity of obamas statement

statement: says the claims that texas faces a billion shortfall are flat out false
subject: state-budget
speaker: talmadge-heflin
job: Director, Center for Fiscal Policy, Texas Public Policy Foundation
justification: heflin said he has no quibble with its methodology but disputes the premise that lawmakers should maintain existing services when you know you dont have the money you know you have to trim back heflin said he followed up via e mail there was never a possibility of funding a current services budget plus wish lists and growth our sense heflins statement rejects a shortfall calculation that seems a reasonable way to estimate how much it would cost texas to keep up services

statement: since january new jersey has added new private sector jobs the last two years and have been the best two years of private sector job growth since
subject: jobs
speaker: chris-christie
context: a budget speech to the New Jersey Legislature
justification: christie said during his budget address tuesday that since january new jersey has added new private sector jobs the last two years and have been the best two years of private sector job growth since the governor is right that new jersey has gained new private sector jobs since but thats counting from february his first full month in office he cited job growth from january christie also is correct that and represent the best two years of private sector job growth since according to bls data and calculations from a rutgers university economist

statement: congress can tell the supreme court which cases they ought to hear we have that authority
subject: supreme-court
speaker: arlen-specter
context: an interview on MSNBC's Daily Rundown
justification: they do have to act in general terms according to the constitution congress has the authority to do just that it can write legislation that gives the court appellate jurisdiction over certain cases as it did when it passed the voting rights act however our experts said congress cannot tell the court that is must hear a specific case

statement: says donald trump has given more money to democratic candidates than republican candidates

statement: says mitt romney wants to add trillion to defense budget that the military hasnt asked for
subject: debates,military
speaker: barack-obama
justification: its hard to see daylight between the military and the white house on this bensahel said broadly speaking it is always possible that the service chiefs would disagree over funding of individual programs but that is within the overall budget limits our ruling the president said romney planned to increase defense spending by trillion and that was money the military hadnt asked for

statement: if the legislature refuses to expand medicaid states are going to get our money virginia taxpayer money into their states to provide health care for their citizens paid for by us
subject: health-care,medicaid,taxes
speaker: terry-mcauliffe
justification: mcauliffe said that the general assemblys refusal to expand medicaid would send virginia taxpayers money into other states to insure their working poor hes right that states have broadened medicaid eligibility under the affordable care act and if virginia doesnt join suit it will sacrifice federal dollars that would pay the overwhelming long term cost of the expansion virginians like residents of all states are subject to new taxes to help support the aca the payments pour into the u s treasury where they are mixed with other tax dollars and piped out to federal programs theres no tracking of individual coins in this flow of money and its possible that some deposits from virginia could end up helping medicaid recipients in other states but contrary to mcauliffes statement theres no direct connection between virginias decision on expansion and what happens to medicaid in other states the goal of expansion is to offer medicaid insurance to people earning up percent of the u s poverty line states participating in the program will receive the same federal subsidy for each new enrollee regardless of whether virginia participates

statement: the trans pacific trade deal could cost america more jobs
subject: trade
speaker: bernie-s
justification: sanders ad says that the trans pacific partnership could cost america more jobs weve asked economists to sort out the good and bad of trade deals before and found that their opinions on outcomes can be wildly contradictory so when it comes to predicting such outcomes it really depends on whose magic ball you use its important for people to understand that this number is an estimate and its the biggest estimate we found critics of the tufts study say it goes the furthest to predict doomsday figures without acknowledging offsetting effects the author of the tufts study says that other research glosses over the real world elements that change the lives of workers in a global economy

statement: barack obama is the first president to file lawsuits against the states he swore an oath to protect
subject: legal-issues,states
speaker: chain-email
justification: the chain email said obama is the first president to file lawsuits against the states he swore an oath to protect but no president swears to protect the states they swear to protect the constitution which sometimes leads to clashes with states andthe president is then obligated to challenge them through lawsuits our quick search produced dozens of examples of the federal government suing states going back a century

statement: more than percent of american adults have committed a crime that could lead to imprisonment
subject: criminal-justice
speaker: stephen-carter
justification: carter said that more than percent of american adults have committed a crime that could lead to imprisonment based on a strictly technical reading of existing laws the consensus among the legal experts we reached is that the number is reasonable way more than a majority of americans have done something in their lives that runs afoul of some law that includes jail or prison time as a potential punishment that said experts acknowledged that the likelihood of arrest prosecution or imprisonment is exceedingly low for many of americans crimes

statement: says ohio attorney general mike dewine is hypocritical for challenging the constitutionality of the new health care law
subject: health-care,voting-record

justification: youll pay a penalty for delaying if you change your mind but you are free not to change your mind you have that choice and about million people or percent of medicare beneficiaries have made that choice according to cms figures cited by the kaiser family foundation not a one of them is paying a fine in other words dewine is not being hypocritical in challenging the health insurance mandate because when he voted in for the prescription insurance program he was not supporting a mandate

statement: a study says massachusetts has lost jobs because residents were required to obtain health insurance under an act signed into law by mitt romney
subject: health-care
speaker: rick-perry
justification: in the dec debate perry cited a study that found increased costs led businesses to create fewer jobs that is certainly plausible although we found no other research supporting that figure more significantly perry s statement makes it sound as if the study says existing jobs in massachusetts were vanquished instead it asserts that jobs were not created in the first place that is it doesn t specify which parts most influenced the states economy

statement: attorney general roy cooper refuses to do his job by not defending house bill in a lawsuit
subject: ethics,gays-and-lesbians,campaign-advertising,states

justification: berger said that by not defending hb in court cooper refuses to do his job as attorney general state law does say cooper s job includes the duty toto defend the statein court however thats not the end of the debate cooper has other possibly conflicting duties and legal scholarstend to side with cooper s argumentthat attorneys general dont always have to defend laws especially ones they believe to be unconstitutional however the issue is a new one in north carolina andthe law is still relatively unsettled

statement: says georgia democratic senate hopeful michelle nunn supports higher taxes
subject: taxes

statement: a year since the recovery summer there has been been a fall winter and spring of no recovery
subject: economy

context: an interview on the Fox Business Channel
justification: its not all sunshine and rainbows but it hasnt been season after season of gloom either

statement: the american murder rate is times that of any other developed nation

statement: says in the state of the union address president obama didnt even mention the deficit or debt

justification: romney said that obama didn t even mention the deficit or the debt in his state of the union address at least six different times in his state of the union address obama mentioned the debt or deficit by name and if romney meant that obama made no mention of how to address the governments debt problems well yes he did he proposed paying down the debt using money no longer being spent in iraq and advocated for letting a top bracket tax cut expire so as not to add to the deficit six mentions in a speech in which romney said there were none

statement: as a former federal prosecutor i prosecuted over cases

statement: their new york casino deal was called rigged and corrupt

statement: says there have been million abortions since roe v wade was decided
subject: abortion
speaker: rick-perry
justification: perry s statement indicating that there have been million abortions in the united states since appears to be on target the guttmacher institute estimates that there were million abortions in the u s through shy of million considering that guttmacher says there were more than million abortions in both and it s reasonable to conclude that the united states has reached the million mark

statement: late changes to the arizona immigration law lay to rest questions over the possibility of racial profiling
subject: immigration,legal-issues

justification: but our legal experts say that it is far from the done deal that she suggests there are simply too many legal loose ends to be settled in court to be able to say that the late changes to the law will lay to rest questions over the possibility of racial profiling as brewer put it

statement: says texas universities have announced or implemented a degree
subject: education
speaker: rick-perry
justification: perry said texas institutions had announced or implemented a degree that count draws on a state researched list by our analysis however only four programs offer degrees earned entirely at the university whose name is on the diploma for or less two more universities expect students to attend community college first but pay a total of or less at both institutions that leaves seven universities that expect students to earn their degrees after corraling up to college credits in other ways that presumably cost additional money several also require students following the degree plans to have income based pell grants or to qualify for other scholarships these realities are more complicated than the governor suggested

statement: says an illegal immigrant fraudulently claimed children who actually lived in mexico on income tax forms to collect more than
subject: immigration,taxes

statement: the state board of administration transparency issue got a great airing the last legislative session
subject: financial-regulation,state-finances,transparency
speaker: ash-williams
job: Executive Director, Florida State Board of Administration
context: response to a question from Gov. Rick Scott
justification: at politifact we re sometimes reluctant to analyze statements that are open to interpretation what s the definition of great in this case but we feel confident that someone seeing williams statement would come away with an impression that is very different from the legislative record in fact the public records sba bill that moved through the house and senate passed with just slightly more debate than is absolutely necessary to comply with state rules that a bill be read three times before it is passed we re not saying it s williams fault that the legislature decided not to speak out on this bill but we do hold him accountable for his words

statement: of doctors have considered leaving the profession because of obamacare

statement: says scott walkers jobs agency gives financial incentives that lead wisconsin companies to look at shipping jobs elsewhere a company got million in taxpayer money and actually reduced its jobs by people
subject: economy,jobs,state-budget,taxes,workers

statement: says that in rick perry spoke favorably of binational health insurance between mexico and texas
subject: health-care,immigration

justification: our ruling perry talked about binational health insurance in a speech as santorum said however his dig about perry s mention wrongly implies that the governor is working to establish binational health insurance

statement: says president abraham lincoln enforced the fugitive slave act until the civil war ended
subject: history
speaker: andrew-napolitano
justification: napolitano said lincoln his marshals and his judges enforced the fugitive slave act until the war was over the record is much more complicated lincoln and other federal officials did enforce the law in some instances in the union states in the early part of the war but not in every state and not consistently the policy was quite different for the confederate states in that same period lincolns military and congress moved to protect slaves who escaped from confederate owners lincoln issued the emancipation proclamation mid way through the war freeing all slaves in confederate states napolitano repeated the word enforced three times for emphasis congress repealed the fugitive slave act in a year before the war ended

statement: says his parents came to america following fidel castros takeover of cuba
subject: candidates-biography,immigration
speaker: marco-rubio
context: a biography on his U.S. Senate website
justification: several times during his race for u s senate rubio told reporters and voters his parents left cuba in suggesting they had fled castro s rule in his campaign bio and later in his official senate biography he said his parents came to america following fidel castro s takeover even after he stumbled over dates with a miami herald reporter and acknowledged his parents left before the revolution his official web bio stayed the same it was updated to say marco was born in miami in to cuban exiles who first arrived in the united states in

statement: our trade deficit in goods reached nearly billion last year alone
subject: economy,trade
speaker: donald-trump
context: a speech at the Republican National Convention in Cleveland
justification: trump said our trade deficit in goods reached nearly billion last year alone in the goods trade deficit was billion

statement: the democrats health care bills would end the denial of coverage to those who have a pre existing condition while the republican bill would not
subject: health-care,abc-news-week
speaker: nancy-pelosi
justification: insurers would still be able to discriminate against those with pre existing conditions the policy would instead allow those who are rejected to be provided access to coverage elsewhere the second is that while it s impossible to know whether the republican approach would succeed or fail it s clear that many health experts are skeptical about the gop s ability to provide coverage to all or virtually all of those who have pre existing conditions ultimately both parties approaches have their critics but we believe that despite some caveats pelosi is basically correct in saying that the democratic approach would explicitly end the denial of coverage to those who have a pre existing condition as for pelosi s belief that the republican approach fails to do the same she unfairly glosses over the fact that the gop proposal makes it a high priority goal and that it provides a path albeit a controversial one to get there still pelosi is correct that under the gop plan insurers would still be able to deny coverage to those with pre existing conditions

statement: says ohios economic recovery started in february
subject: economy
speaker: ted-strickland
justification: it was kasich after all who repeatedly dinged strickland for hundreds of thousands of lost jobs the issue is likely to remain a key talking point in the gubernatorial race

statement: gov scott walker is helping pay for the criminal defense of a man accused of boy rape
subject: crime
speaker: graeme-zielinski
justification: hes using social media shorthand in a brazen effort to link walker to defending pierick amid the allegations of sex crimes he suggests or imply that the governor supports or defends boy rape

statement: barack obama pays for every dime of his spending plans
subject: federal-budget
speaker: barack-obama
justification: we give obama credit for the level of detail many of his proposals have when it comes to spending and cost but obama doesn t pay for every dime of his proposals

statement: says there were multiple instances of voter fraud in wood county ohio
subject: elections
speaker: viral-image
context: viral image circulating on the internet
justification: the numbers registered voters and residents old enough to vote include the ghost registrations of inactive voters that lingered on the rolls finally obama got percent of the vote in wood county not percent

statement: says canada has one tenth of our populationyet it issues far more high skilled visas more than yearly than we do
subject: corrections-and-updates,immigration
speaker: jeb-bush
justification: bush and bolick said that canada issues more than high skilled visa a year compared to by the u s that refers not to people with visas but those granted permanent resident status and it includes family members of skilled workers as well as workers who are not high skilled if they had meant to speak of canadas temporary foreign workers a reasonable fit with the h b program the high water mark for such workers in canada was about in thats still about half of the number they put on the table on a relative basis canada does target high skilled workers much more than the u s but the absolute numbers bush and bolick used fell wide of the mark

statement: says a group estimates that the annual cost to oregon taxpayers for government services to illegal aliens after any income tax revenue from them is billion
subject: economy,education,immigration,state-budget,taxes,workers
speaker: oregon-republican-party
justification: there is some basis for some of the numbers we can sympathize with critics of illegal immigration who say its appropriate to include the costs of educating children even if they are u s citizens but citizens are not aliens and the bulk of the estimated billion goes to provide services to people entitled to receive those services

statement: says for the first time ever texas lawmakers are not funding student population growth
subject: education,state-budget,state-finances
speaker: wendy-davis
justification: he pointed out that a book the development of education in texas states that until lawmakers in offered more money for manual training classes texas had always adhered to the policy of distributing state educational funds on the per capita basis for the first time in more than years the budget approved by legislators does not fully account for enrollment increases prior to information to prove or disprove davis statement is more fuzzy but it s clear that texas has allocated education funding on a per student basis since the th century

statement: leticia van de putte voted to give illegal immigrants in this country free health care not emergency health care but total free health care
subject: health-care,immigration,public-health
speaker: dan-patrick
justification: patrick said van de putte voted to give illegal immigrants in this country free health care not emergency health care but total free health care the proposal in question didnt provide immigrants free across the board health care rather the measure permitted and didnt require local governing bodies to provide or it appears resume providing non emergency services to residents regardless of immigration status an action that was predicted to improve outcomes and head off costly emergency care to which all residents were already entitled per federal law significantly too the proposal envisioned patients sharing costs

statement: since sequester began federal employment has been subtracting jobs per month
subject: federal-budget,jobs
speaker: political-line
justification: reviewing the data over the previous months does show an overall downward trend in federal government jobs but the monthly totals fluctuate and overall the job reduction is far less than the statement would indicate

statement: says no austin city council member lives south of lady bird lake or north of th street
subject: city-government
speaker: shaun-ireland
context: a campaign video on the city's website
justification: no council members live in south austin as ireland says and five council members live south of th street if that street were extended east and west though leffingwell and martinez would land north of it though not by much

statement: ohio taxpayers spent more than million for the year on food stamps and medicaid for wal mart workers
subject: health-care,state-budget
speaker: robert-hagan
context: a speech in the Ohio House of Representatives
justification: he might have fared better if he had made his point by citing the number of wal mart workers on welfare an exact number at his fingertips rather than swing for the fences by throwing out a juicy and inexact multimillion dollar cost to ohio taxpayers while it is clear thousands of wal mart workers and their dependents are on welfare neither hagan nor the ohio department of job and family services knows the precise cost

statement: one out of every five law enforcement officers thats killed is killed with an assault weapon
subject: crime,guns
speaker: dianne-feinstein
context: an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation"
justification: because the definition of assault weapon is subject to debate the categorization of any given weapon is open to some interpretation still while the numbers were analyzed by a group with a stake in the fight we find the data reasonable the data has been consistent in the five years studied and at worst feinstein s figure for the most recent year is only a few percentage points high

statement: mitt romney did not run his campaign on the basis of arguing his experience in the business world was a reason to vote for him
subject: elections,campaign-advertising
speaker: scott-walker

statement: last year actually this year in may we saw new jersey transit fares rise anywhere from percent to percent

statement: weve got four supreme court justices who signed their name to a declaration that americans have no fundamental right to self defense

context: a speech at the annual convention of the National Rifle Association
justification: nugent an nra board member for almost years told a crowd that weve got four supreme court justices who signed their name to a declaration that americans have no fundamental right to self defense we find the phrase a declaration an exaggeration along with the suggestion that all four justices are still on the court but hes correct that four justices signed on to dissenting opinions in district of columbia vs heller that find some right to self defense but arguably not a fundamental right earning the supreme courts highest level of protection he used the right phrase still a declaration and four justices make the statement just partially accurate

statement: under our budget the average wisconsin property taxpayer will save

statement: al qaida has grown fourfold in five years

statement: says studies show the average age of entry into prostitution is to years old

statement: when we got the income tax in the top rate was percent by the top rate was percent

statement: says president dwight eisenhower moved million illegal immigrants out of this country

justification: trump said president eisenhower moved million illegal immigrants out of this country trump is referring to a campaign known as operation wetback while the idea that the operation resulted in more than million deportations is not pulled out of thin air historians widely cite that number as far too high for a variety of reasons including the fact that hundreds of thousands of undocumented immigrants would have had to self deport also it wasnt just a deportation program the campaign accompaniedmore legal immigration opportunities

statement: by the time i finish this speech two americans will be slain six women will be raped of us will be robbed and more will be beaten
subject: corrections-and-updates,crime
speaker: wayne-lapierre
context: a speech to a national meeting of the National Rifle Association
justification: overall lapierres estimate was fairly accurate he was very close with assaults and off by just percent for rape and percent for robbery but he offered a rate of killing that was twice as high as the actual rate update after our story came out the national rifle association got back to us rounded up that equals two deaths during the period of the speech however we arent convinced by the methodology the nhtsa data for includes people who were passengers in the drunk drivers car occupants of other cars on the road or bystanders thats only about one third of the total fatalities the majority of deaths in such crashes are of the alcohol impaired driver we dont think deaths of alcohol impaired drivers fit the definition of slain unless you also include suicides more generally which as we noted above would make lapierres estimate significantly lower than the actual number

statement: common core is being used by the obama administration to turn the department of education into what is effectively a national school board

statement: for immigrants with visa overstays we make no effort to hold them accountable to that or uphold the law

statement: by the time mitt romney left office massachusetts was th in the nation in job creation

statement: in states where the federal government helps run these health care marketplaces the average american will have more than different plans to choose from with different levels of coverage

statement: the consumer financial protection bureau passed a rule giving the agency unprecedented power to shut down businesses no matter what the reason at any time it wishes
subject: financial-regulation
speaker: katie-pavlich
justification: pavlich recently wrote for townhall the consumer financial protection bureau through the power of dodd frank passed a rule giving the agency unprecedented power to shut down businesses no matter what the reason at any time it wishes through a cease and desist order she is mistaken an attorney who represents the financial services industry told us pavlich ignores several key facts about the agencys temporary cease and desist authority namely its not unprecedented its not issued without reason and its meant to stop violations of law not the business altogether

statement: dnc chair debbie wasserman schultz denied unemployment went up under obama
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: republican-national-committee-republican
justification: the enemy of clarity is cross talk the twists and implications in this conversation happen fast and are not explained to viewers leaving some with the impression that wasserman schultz emphatically disagrees with the fact that there are more people without jobs today than in early the devil is usually in the details however and in this case carlson s start to the conversation did not express exactly that wasserman schultz insisted something else that it hadn t gone up precipitously and that it is not going up

statement: mccain voted against renewable sources of energy against biofuels against solar power against wind power
subject: energy
speaker: barack-obama
justification: he attacks mccain for voting against the energy bill which carried federal subsidies for a host of renewable energy programs still that energy bill vote doesn t reflect the whole of mccain s record on renewable energy as obama s statement makes it sound

statement: says connie mack iv has been a promoter for hooters with a history of bar room brawling altercations and road rage
subject: candidates-biography,10-news-tampa-bay
speaker: bill-nelson
justification: nelson told tv viewers across the state florida meet connie mack iv a promoter for hooters with a history of bar room brawling altercations and road rage the word arrest appeared during the ad nelson omitted the timeline on the criminal history and road rage those incidents occurred in the late s and early s mack was in s at the time hes now about to turn but mack did work as a promoter for hooters and has a history of bar room brawling altercations and road rage politifact florida is partnering with news for the election

statement: i m the first person who really took up the issue of the war four years ago i said that there was no proof that iraq had weapons of mass destruction and actually did an analysis which disproved the cause for the war
subject: iraq
speaker: dennis-kucinich
justification: but kucinich earned the title as the leader of the anti war movement in late august after holding a widely reported capitol hill briefing where he called for more discussion about why we should not go to war according to an article in the cleveland plain dealer he then began building a congressional coalition against the war unilateral military action by the united states against iraq is unjustified unwarranted and illegal said kucinich according to the washington times on sept the administration has failed to make the case that iraq poses an imminent or immediate threat to the united states

statement: our recent state budgets have far exceeded population and inflation growth
subject: population,state-budget,state-finances
speaker: tom-pauken
justification: pauken said recent state budgets have far exceeded population and inflation growth spending of all funds which folds in federal aid exceeded population and inflation growth in five of six recent texas budgets adjusted for those factors the two year budgets went up as little as percent to nearly percent and while total spending trailed population growth inflation in that conclusion could change once number crunchers account for final spending decisions by the legislature in contrast state spending alone over which lawmakers have the most direct control trailed population growth and inflation in four of the six two year budgets from through and its not expected to exceed inflation population growth through august

statement: the vast majority of our international commitments take effect without congressional approval
subject: congress,foreign-policy
speaker: joe-biden
context: a statement released to the media
justification: biden said the vast majority of our international commitments take effect without congressional approval when looking at binding agreements the only types of agreements for which we have good data biden is likely offbase biden may be on safer ground once you add in non binding agreements

statement: says the federal stimulus program was ineffective because the number of jobs has actually decreased by through july
subject: jobs,stimulus
speaker: greg-walden
justification: while economists and other experts say its impossible to say how many oregon jobs were created or saved as the white house puts it there certainly were some and its clear that a significant number of oregon jobs would have been lost without the stimulus waldens assertion of lost jobs uses numbers out of context and leaves out important details

statement: the united states regulations are among the most difficult in the world
subject: economy,environment,health-care,market-regulation
speaker: rick-scott
justification: scott said our regulations are among the most difficult in the world even if some companies move overseas or cut jobs and attribute those actions to overregulation that doesn t mean that regulations in the u s are among the most difficult in the world the reports we found ranked the u s between th and th for business climate scott along with other political or business leaders certainly can point to concerns about the number cost or impact of regulations but scott hasn t proven that our country s regulations are among the most difficult in the world

statement: says sherrod brown voted for the trillion health care law that adds a new tax on ohio manufacturers
subject: health-care,taxes
speaker: crossroads-gps
justification: dissenters say it could cost jobs and force business overseas in ohio crossroads said about workers are employed by makers of medical devices and equipment those jobs amout to about percent of the more than workers in ohio that the u s bureau of labor statistics says are employed in manufacturing

statement: sen mcconnell offered a fully paid two month extension of unemployment insurance
subject: economy,federal-budget
speaker: john-cornyn
context: a conference call with Texas reporters
justification: of late congressional efforts to extend unemployment insurance benefits have failed including mcconnell s proposal to finance an extension by paying for it with stimulus funding

statement: the video doesn t show the broader picture of the firing that was going on at american troops
subject: iraq,military,abc-news-week
speaker: robert-gates
justification: but we think gates words suggest he was speaking more broadly of the context around that incident that as finkel noted in providing context during his q a insurgents had been firing at american soldiers in that immediate area that very morning and military reports support that

statement: under obamacare percent of small businesses now say they are going to be forced to either fire workers or cut their hours
subject: economy,health-care,jobs,small-business
speaker: marco-rubio
justification: rubio arguing to defund obamacare said percent of small businesses now say they are going to be forced to either fire workers or cut their hours in the study of small businesses he cited less than percent said they might make that choice his office cited a news article that misinterpreted ambiguous results from an interest group survey but basic statistics about americas small businesses show the number was seriously unlikely and a quick message to the u s chamber exposed the error

statement: when peppers tax was finally voted down pepper laid off cops and closed jails and let criminals run free in the streets
subject: government-efficiency,job-accomplishments,message-machine,taxes
