context: an interview on Fox 5’s Good Day New York
justification: after the payment increases have been fully implemented those contribution levels return to the bargaining table as a part of union negotiations

statement: says a congressional budget office report on spending by house democrats in the economic stimulus concluded it is just not stimulus it won t help the economy grow
subject: economy,stimulus
speaker: eric-cantor
context: an interview on the Fox News Channel.
justification: if cantor s point is that democrats have been too optimistic in how quickly they can create jobs through infrastructure projects the cbo data give a bit of ammunition to suggest that such projects will likely take several years to unfold but the way cantor said it suggests that the nonpartisan and well regarded cbo had come out with a report that said the opposition party s proposal wouldn t work that s a serious distortion of three pages of data that simply laid out a likely timeline of spending yes coupled with other data it is possible to make an argument that the proposed infrastructure spending won t provide an urgently needed boost to the ecomony but that s not an argument the cbo weighs in on one way or another

statement: members of congress and their families and staff are exempt from repaying student loans
subject: congressional-rules,education
speaker: chain-email
justification: in congress passed the congressional accountability act which applied laws to members that hadn t applied previously several of the laws involved discrimination in the workplace including the civil rights act of the americans with disabilities act of and the family and medical leave act of getting back to the question at hand though the chain e mail said that members of congress their families and staff members do not have to repay student loans

statement: says new jerseys unemployment is significantly lower than it was when i got here and weve created new private sector jobs in the last months after having lost in the year before i got here
subject: jobs
speaker: chris-christie
justification: christie said new jersey s unemployment is significantly lower than it was when i got here and we ve created new private sector jobs in the last months after having lost in the year before i got here his statistics on private sector job growth are accurate and the unemployment rate is lower but the unemployment decline is not statistically significant and as weve said in the past christie cant take all the credit for job growth in the garden state

statement: u s military involvement in libya allowed thousands of surface to air missiles to fall into the hands of radical islamists
subject: military,terrorism
speaker: rand-paul
job: Candidate for U.S. Senate and physician
justification: paul said thatu s military involvement in libya allowed thousands of surface to air missiles to fall into the hands of radical islamists experts told us that even though some terrorists are known to have a few libyan surface to air missiles the idea that they have thousands is extremely unlikely while many of libyas surface to air missiles went missing during the conflict thousands more were destroyed recovered rendered inoperable or believed to be in the hands of militias that arent radical islamic terrorists the weapon looting began before the united states and nato showed up and when they showed up they destroyed or recovered many thousands its arguable that american involvement had the exact opposite effect than what paul asserts

statement: marijuana contains to percent more carcinogenic hydrocarbons than tobacco
subject: drugs
speaker: michael-cerullo
justification: when michael cerullo said marijuana contains to percent more carcinogenic hydrocarbons than tobacco he was quoting a reputable source it depends on whether you are talking about smoke inhaled by the user or second hand smoke

statement: the u s wont default because default means that you dont pay your creditors and it takes about percent of the money thats coming in right now to pay interest to bondholders
subject: deficit,economy
speaker: tom-price
context: an interview on CNN's "State of the Union with Candy Crowley"
justification: well concede that were in relatively uncharted territory however independent experts suggest that simply paying debt holders while letting other federal creditors go unpaid wont keep the u s from default either the technical or the common sense variety in addition both academic experts and the congressional research service agree that only paying debt holders wont be enough to keep u s creditworthiness unblemished price downplays the real risks of default and creditworthiness in a prioritization strategy that pays debt holders at the expense of other federal credit holders

statement: in the first year of the obama administration more jobs were created in the private sector than in the eight years of the bush administration
subject: economy,history
speaker: nancy-pelosi
justification: and she chose her starting and ending dates in a way that was highly favorable to obama and unfavorable to bush pelosi essentially started counting from the low point for jobs and only counted the upward part of the trendline while denying bush the same method this time in talking to bloomberg tv pelosi didnt even get the statistic technically correct

statement: in austin ive got half a dozen or more schools on a list to be closed one of which i presented a federal blue ribbon award to for excellence and several hundred school personnel on the list for possible terminations
subject: education
speaker: lloyd-doggett
job: Texas congressman in the U.S. Houst of Representatives
justification: but dohl said the school closure list seems to still be a very real issue and doggett believes school closures should be avoided all told doggetts comment accurately refers to zilker elementary and possible district layoffs at the time he spoke though the task force that aired school closing suggestions had backed off the specifics and it s not certain any schools are to be closed

statement: when carly fiorina says hewlett packard revenues went up thats because she bought compaq it was a terrible deal
subject: candidates-biography,job-accomplishments,technology
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump said when carly says the revenues went up that s because she bought compaq it was a terrible deal and it really led to the destruction of the company though the hp compaq merger was almost universally condemned at the time the deal took place time has made the merger look better in the minds of some but theres no question that the growth in hps revenue did indeed come from its merger with compaq that means its not organic growth but rather merely due to increase in the volume of the combined company

statement: latinos are percent of our countrys population but hold only percent of its wealth
subject: diversity,economy,families,income,population,poverty
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: clinton said latinos are percent of our country s population but hold only percent of its wealth census bureau data confirm the percent federal reserve data from and more recent data from show that the percent figure is on target as well

statement: says hillary clinton filibustered legislation to reform fannie mae and freddie mac
subject: candidates-biography,housing
speaker: donald-trump
justification: in an attempt to assign responsibility for the financial crisis to clinton trumps campaign accused her of filibustering legislation that would have changed how two government backed mortgage giants were regulated republican leadership chose not to bring the bill before the whole senate after it passed out of committee

statement: hillary clinton agrees with john mccain in embracing the bush cheney policy of not talking to leaders we don t like
subject: foreign-policy
speaker: barack-obama
justification: but obama strays badly in taking that shared view and equating it with what he calls the bush cheney policy of not talking to leaders we don t like clinton who was asked about it directly clearly says she would approach diplomacy differently than the bush administration has

statement: right now american oil production is the highest that its been in eight years
subject: energy
speaker: barack-obama
context: the State of the Union address
justification: obama was correct when he said that right now american oil production is the highest that its been in eight years we think he may have overstated his administrations role in achieving that but not wildly so

statement: no one questioned that she judge sotomayor was out of the mainstream
subject: supreme-court,abc-news-week
speaker: charles-schumer
justification: a june story in roll call noted that talking points prepared for house and senate republicans urged members to make the case that sotomayor s written statements rulings and speeches show an out of the mainstream view of the role of a judge we understand that out of the mainstream is a subjective term but the fact is that a number of republican senators used that exact phrase

statement: every four minutes another american home or business goes solar
subject: energy
speaker: barack-obama
justification: during the state of the union obama said every four minutes another american home or business goes solar obama obtained that figure from an august report from greentech media solar has been expanding but it remains a small slice of the overall market

statement: were talking right now about a billion hole in our current so called balanced state budget
subject: education,health-care,state-budget
speaker: donna-howard
context: East Austin meetup of Texans for Obama.
justification: donna howard says the current so called balanced state budget has a billion hole lawmakers did not cover all projected state costs of medicaid in and put off a regular payment to school districts as before too portions of funds intended for special purposes were set aside to balance the budget on the other hand school districts have not been slammed by the deferral and the agency overseeing medicaid doesnt expect consequences to eligible texans unless lawmakers unexpectedly fail to cover costs during the legislative session howards hole traces to funding shortfalls in the latest budget but that budget still was balanced

statement: says ron paul insisted fema should be shut down
subject: federal-budget,public-safety,weather
speaker: maureen-dowd
job: Columnist for the New York Times
justification: federal bureaucracies as a whole dont do a very good job but fema has the worst reputation of almost any of them he also said that the government should look at how things were handled before we had fema later in the interview paul said the federal government should be available for disaster related rescues pauls campaign didnt respond to our inquiry

statement: under president barack obamas watch oil production on federal lands has decreased percent over the past year
subject: energy
speaker: jack-kingston
justification: were also not taking issue with kingstons oil production data our issue is context and thats where kingston runs into trouble he cherry picked the most unflattering oil production numbers under the obama administration and ignored the impact of events well outside the presidents control changes in technology decades of presidential policy and most importantly the deepwater horizon spill kingstons statement is partially accurate but leaves out important details or takes things out of context

statement: in her first appellate argument ms kagan told the court that the speech and press guarantees in the first amendment would allow the federal government to ban the publication of pamphlets discussing political issues before an election
subject: campaign-finance,elections,kagan-nomination
speaker: jeff-sessions
justification: that s an awful lot of limiting context left out and the point is further muddled by using the example of paine s common sense it s not at all clear that that pamphlet would have fallen under the regulation of the mccain feingold act

statement: says barack obama has pension investments that include chinese firms and investments through a caymans trust
subject: china,debates,pensions,taxes
speaker: mitt-romney
justification: you also have investments outside the united states you also have investments through a caymans trust its an accurate set of statements when you consider investments made by managers of the illinois pension fund in which obama has an account

statement: says sen thad cochran voted to spend hundreds of millions of dollars on the bridge to nowhere in alaska instead of shifting the money to repair a bridge damaged by hurricane katrina
subject: federal-budget,infrastructure,transportation,weather
speaker: chris-chocola
job: President of the Club for Growth
context: an op-ed supporting Senate candidate Chris McDaniel
justification: chocola said cochran voted to spend hundreds of millions of dollars on the bridge to nowhere in alaska instead of shifting the money to repair a bridge damaged by hurricane katrina cochran did vote that way on a specific amendment but just a few weeks later cochran played a key role in securing funding for the i twin span bridge

statement: a study showed that president barack obamas health care reforms will devastate wisconsin by pushing people off employer sponsored insurance driving up premiums increasing dependency and making people ineligible for medicaid
subject: federal-budget,health-care,medicaid,medicare,state-budget,states
speaker: scott-walker
justification: our rating in an opinion piece in the washington post walker said obamacare will push people off employer sponsored insurance drive up premiums increase dependency and make people including pregnant women ineligible for medicaid the context of his comments is his assertion that this will devastate wisconsin indeed some of the numbers he attributes to the study are really estimates from his own administration

statement: says ted cruz represents a chinese company found guilty of stealing blueprints from an american manufacturer
subject: candidates-biography,legal-issues,message-machine-2012
speaker: david-dewhurst
justification: matteiss comment about the word guilty strikes us as valid viewers might take guilty in dewhurst s ad as hinting that cruz represents someone convicted of a criminal act cruz is representing a chinese firm found liable for stealing blueprints

statement: if you look at last year s presidential campaign you can t find a mention of public option
subject: health-care
speaker: joe-lieberman
justification: major newspapers produced about significant stories or op eds on obama and the public option in june july and august lieberman said it s classic politics of our time that if you look at the campaign last year presidential you can t find a mention of public option we found a few mentions but the public option was not at all a significant point of debate during the presidential campaign

statement: with a stroke of a pen the u s supreme court decided to overrule the year old ban on corporate expenditures
subject: corporations,elections,legal-issues,supreme-court
speaker: charles-schumer
justification: you could also argue that we should be dating this from the s campaign finance laws or even the austin case so he s exaggerating the scope of the ruling and how long the laws have been on the books

statement: says rick scott oversaw the largest medicare fraud in the nations history
subject: candidates-biography,medicaid,medicare
speaker: florida-democratic-party
justification: the florida democratic party said scott oversaw the largest medicare fraud in the nations history the columbia hca settlement has since been surpassed in dollar value though the bigger cases involved medicare somewhat less directly

statement: says new jersey has fewer jobs since gov chris christie took office
subject: jobs
speaker: joshua-henne
context: a press release from One New Jersey
justification: the data used to measure jobs shows a slight increase since christie became governor even though some economists said the growth is mainly flat but new jersey also has seen an increase in private sector jobs a measure considered by a rutgers professor to appropriately reflect the state of the economy beyond crediting or blaming christie economists said other factors include the recession and individual job markets

statement: rosalyn dance voted against president obamas medicaid expansion
subject: health-care,state-budget,voting-record
speaker: joe-morrissey
justification: morrissey says dance voted against president obamas medicaid expansion dance as morrissey points out has voted for state budgets that didnt expand medicaid but that doesnt mean she was voting against the medicaid growth specifically budgets are huge documents that fund more than billion in state programs a year and go through many votes sometimes dance shunned protest votes against the budgets that did not expand medicaid because she says she supported many other priorities in the spending plan in however she joined all fellow democrats in voting against the a final budget its important to note that dance always voted in favor of expanding medicaid when faced with specific floor votes on the issue

statement: says donald trump wants us to pull out of nato
subject: federal-budget,foreign-policy,military
speaker: hillary-clinton
justification: but even that is short of trump saying he wants to pull the united states out of nato our rating clinton says donald trump wants us to pull out of nato trump certainly has opened the door to that possibility suggesting that if reforms arent made to mission and cost sharing he might consider pulling the united states out of the organization but he hasnt gone to say he wants to pull the united states out

statement: the wisconsin state assembly chambers extend to the bathroom and the parlor and rules allow members to vote for each other if the member is in the chambers
subject: ethics
speaker: joel-kleefisch
justification: hes correct but thats only part of the story as kleefisch said it depends on how you interpret the rule the rules are clear on what is the chamber but dont specifically allow the vote for your neighbor approach however that is the longstanding informal tradition of the body

statement: says president barack obama doubled the national debt which had taken more than two centuries to accumulate in one year
subject: debt
speaker: chain-email
justification: starting with his inauguration the largest over the year increase in either form of national debt was about percent even after roughly three and a half years into his presidency both forms of debt still have not doubled

statement: says texas has the fourth lowest debt per capita of any state in the nation and we are the lowest of any of the big states
subject: state-budget,state-finances
speaker: rick-perry
justification: the report says the ratio is useful for comparing different states and countries in an interview moodys analyst nicole johnson said that a relatively low ratio generally means a state has more flexibility to increase its debt than states with high ratios so texas has the least state debt per capita among the most populous states as perry says and by moodys accounting the th lowest of all states perry incorrectly said it was fourth lowest of all states but his meaning holds up texas is a relatively low debt state

statement: wisconsin still ranks first among the states in manufacturing jobs per capita
subject: job-accomplishments,jobs
speaker: rebecca-kleefisch
justification: walker took office in january still though wisconsin is manufacturing jobs short of its january total according to september federal figures economists debate the wisdom of heavy reliance on that sector but kleefisch accurately describes the states ranking

statement: after a decade of decline this country created over half a million manufacturing jobs in the last two and a half years
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: barack-obama
context: his acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.
justification: thats over half a million manufacturing jobs as obama put it its worth noting that while the reversal has been striking this rise has still replaced only a fraction of the manufacturing jobs lost during the decade of decline the manufacturing jobs gained during the turnaround replaced less than percent of the jobs lost during the decade of decline our rating the rise in manufacturing jobs that obama is referring to may be modest compared to the prior decades decline but he has described the numbers carefully

statement: in the last months our economy has produced about million private sector jobs
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: bill-clinton
context: a speech to the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.
justification: million number he said in the last months our economy has produced about million private sector jobs

statement: the fed created trillion in the bailout process and trillion went overseas
subject: economy,new-hampshire-2012
speaker: ron-paul
context: a house party in New Hampshire
justification: but that s not what we re assessing when paul says the fed created trillion he is misstating the work of the gao and he fails to account for the special power of the federal reserve to destroy the dollars it creates

statement: new jersey taxpayers will now face the highest tolls in the country
subject: transportation
speaker: steve-lonegan
justification: with a toll hike on the parkway and turnpike new jersey now has the highest tolls in the country according to lonegan lonegan argued that new jerseys toll burden is greater than the rest of the country but he said highest tolls in his newsletter and there are other roads charging more per mile for drivers to head out on the highway

statement: the majority of my contributions have been from private individuals giving on average not from pacs not from groups
subject: campaign-finance,elections,legal-issues
speaker: ed-fallone
justification: the wisconsin club for growth spent on behalf of roggensacks campaign our rating fallone said the majority of my contributions have been from private individuals giving on average not from pacs not from groups his statement is accurate with those clarifications

statement: today we have more boots on the ground near the southwest border than at any time in our history
subject: immigration
speaker: barack-obama
justification: arguments about immigration enforcement will no doubt go on but obama s statement on border agents is sound in the context of today s debate today we have more boots on the ground near the southwest border than at any time in our history he said we do have more agents than anytime since the early s but there have been times in our history when the u s sent troops to the border and many more people than are there to guard the border today

statement: saysdemocratic candidate for state school superintendent alisha thomas morgan voted to slash funding for the preschool programs for disabled and special needs students
subject: education
speaker: valarie-wilson
job: Executive Director of the Atlanta BeltLine Partnership, Inc.
justification: these programs represent a small fraction of the states multibillion dollar annual budget politifact has encountered many cases where candidates accuse elected officials of supporting cuts without noting that these votes were parts of larger budget decisions wilsons attack against morgan omits key context

statement: says the director of nasa says its main mission is muslim outreach
subject: space
speaker: michael-sullivan
justification: sullivan s tweet says bolden said nasas main mission is muslim outreach that s akin to saying the agency is deserting outer space to concentrate on residents of the nile delta which would be unbelievable that said bolden acknowledged to politifact that he mischaracterized the agency s main mission in the remark about obama charging him to do three things that is he said something close to what sullivan said he said and wishes he hadn t

statement: gm and chrysler repaid their loans
subject: candidates-biography,corporations,economy,message-machine-2012,stimulus
speaker: barack-obama
context: in campaign video “The Road We’ve Traveled”
justification: but for both companies thats some careful framing that doesnt tell the whole story loans represent about percent of the bailout a look at the entire bailout shows loans to the old car companies that may never be repaid plus outstanding stock investments in gm and the former gmac the new companies which got about percent of the loans have repaid them all were not weighing obamas courage or the bailouts success on the larger bailout its too early to say how taxpayers will make out this statement is partially accurate but leaves out important details

statement: says barack obama is a muslim
subject: candidates-biography,religion
speaker: hank-williams-jr
justification: obama is not a muslim this has been clear for years

statement: most of west virginia is still owned in excess of percent by out of state interests
subject: environment,public-health,wealth
speaker: bob-kincaid
justification: kincaid said during the broadcast that more than percent of west virginia is owned by out of state interests kincaid gets credit for his readiness to correct his original statement but we fact check what he said on air

statement: virginia is the only state that has a tradition of attorneys general resigning if they run for governor
subject: states
speaker: ken-cuccinelli
justification: cuccinelli said virginia is the only state that has a tradition of attorneys general resigning if they run for governor theres no doubt that the custom exists in virginia the last six attorneys general have resigned to run for governor dating back to cuccinelli plans to break that string this year no one it seems keeps data on whether the custom exists in other states so we researched every gubernatorial election in the u s since and along the way ran across information from a few earlier elections all told we found states outside virginia where attorneys general ran for governor none of the candidates resigned

statement: a muslim immigrant in michigan can list his second third or fourth wives as extended family and qualify for welfare
subject: immigration,income,islam,welfare
speaker: chain-email
justification: a viral youtube video said that in michigan a muslim man lists one wife as his and signs the other two or three up as extended family on welfare for one the rules of the immigration system make it very hard for immigrants who may have multiple wives to enter the country as the united states does not recognize polygamy for most welfare programs it would not be possible for additional wives to qualify for assistance however a muslim man with multiple wives and meets the right income and residency requirements could theoretically benefit through food stamps because it is based on the number of people in the household not just legally recognized family members flaws in the system dont exactly mean the government is subsidizing polygamy

statement: tim kaine announced he wants to raise taxes on everyone
subject: taxes
speaker: george-allen
justification: kaine in response to a question said he would be open to a proposal that would have some minimum tax level on everyone but did not endorse the concept if such a policy was enacted it would not mean that everyone would pay higher income taxes it would mean that the percent of filers who had no income tax liability would pay something even if you go beyond the debate statement the allen camp points to and look at kaines other major tax positions ending the bush era cuts for those earning more than and eliminating some tax deductions in exchange for lowering rates that does not equate to a plan that would raise taxes on everyone

statement: senate health care legislation will levy a new abortion premium fee on americans in the government run plan
subject: abortion
speaker: john-boehner
job: Speaker of the House of Representatives
justification: the bill does not require a fee or a charge above and beyond the premium cost specifically to cover abortions and technically speaking we don t know whether the public option will offer abortion coverage or not instead it gives the health and human services secretary a minimum for estimating the cost of covering abortions

statement: a proposed ban on hollow point bullets and bullets that expand upon impact essentially bans deer hunting
subject: guns,recreation
speaker: vicki-mckenna
justification: kessler admitted hunting never crossed his mind when the bill was drafted in an effort to protect mass shooting victims the city slickers came up with a bill with a problem that stood out like a white tail between the cross hairs as it stood the law would have banned the bullets but it didnt ban hunting

statement: after losing jobs a month before this administration the u s economy under barack obama has had straight months of growth has added million jobs in the private sector and added millions of jobs in manufacturing
subject: economy,jobs
speaker: debbie-wasserman-schultz
context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
justification: on wasserman schultzs first two points we have no major quibbles on the third the number is accurate according to one calculation but it is cherry picked in a way that sheds the most favorable light on the president we realize that she said we ve begun to add millions of jobs suggesting more to come meanwhile were downgrading her for overselling obamas role in job creation

statement: says democratic legislators this year dont want to cut your taxes under any circumstances
subject: taxes
speaker: chris-christie
justification: the main topic in trenton has been competing tax cut proposals made by christie and the democrats christie may disagree with them on how to cut taxes but theres no doubt that many democrats are willing to do just that

statement: under the affordable care act anyone on medicare who is admitted to a hospital for observation will be responsible for the bill medicare wont pay a cent
subject: health-care,medicare
speaker: chain-email
justification: the chain email said that under the affordable care act anyone on medicare who is admitted to a hospital for observation will be responsible for the bill medicare won t pay a cent medicare will cover the hospital stay minus standard copayments and the like patients kept in the hospital under observation will not be able to receive medicare reimbursements for follow up care such as nursing home stays however in reality this stems from a separate policy decision and had nothing to do with obamas law

statement: says hillary clinton was asked repeatedly to provide security in benghazi on several occasions including direct cables
subject: foreign-policy,terrorism
speaker: rand-paul
job: Candidate for U.S. Senate and physician
context: an appearance on CNN’s ‘State of the Union’
justification: paul blamed clinton for benghazi security failures saying she was asked repeatedly to provide security in benghazi on several occasions including direct cables the state department was asked repeatedly for additional u s security staff in libya for example theres no direct cable that automatically appears on the secretary of states desk instead all cables would have carried her name and only those passed up the chain by staff would have reached her she says these ones didnt

statement: pasco county opened new schools over six years to keep pace with growth in student population and implement the class size amendment
subject: education
speaker: heather-fiorentino
job: superintendent of Pasco County's public schools
justification: but when it came time to implement the class size amendment in even with enrollment changed only slightly the district did not meet the voter requirement for smaller classes the state imposed a million penalty against pasco for its failure to comply the fourth highest fine among the districts that did not meet the rule fiorentino and the school board have since submitted a plan to the state department of education for meeting the amendment in which could reduce the punishment while the district did open many new schools to cope with growth and class size it didnt open the same number fiorentino said and it didnt meet class size rules every year

statement: obama raises taxes on seniors and hard working families to give welfare to those who pay none
subject: taxes
speaker: john-mccain
justification: using the term welfare to describe refundable tax credits not by most people s definition that the plan would give payments to people who pay no taxes only if you don t consider payroll taxes as taxes

statement: the u s has to go to plane graveyards and museums to get parts for its year old jet fighters while it sells new jets to other countries
subject: military
speaker: donald-trump
justification: while in texas trump said the u s has to go to plane graveyards and museums to get parts for its year old jet fighters while it sells new jets to other countries the government indeed salvages parts for military planes remaining in action and the u s also sells aircraft to militaries abroad the described parts salvaging which can save time and money doesnt appear to be misguided and the u s also buys new planes for its forces

statement: for now we are still below average in the metro region
subject: government-efficiency
speaker: francis-kungu
justification: dekalb s population grew faster than many of its neighbors thus its infrastructure has more wear and tear the county has a billion repair list could that be why dekalb s rates are lower perhaps said sally bethea executive director of the upper chattahoochee riverkeeper a group that has monitored atlanta s efforts to fix its sewer system they may have not yet made the kinds of investments atlanta has made she said if you focus solely on the larger counties or all governments that dekalb studied the numbers do show dekalb s rates for the average customer are below the metro average

statement: japans interest on its own debt is percent of its national budget
subject: economy,abc-news-week
speaker: daniel-senor
job: Adjunct Senior Fellow for Middle Eastern Studies at Council on Foreign Relations
justification: we checked with senor who told us that even if we go with the percent his broader point stands japan s debt is not sustainable as we said before that s a mess we ll leave to the economists our goal was to see if senor was using the correct figures and we found that he wasn t even if we go with the higher of the two figures senor missed the target by nearly half

statement: did obama know that tony rezko was saving him on the purchase of his home
subject: ethics
speaker: republican-national-committee-republican
justification: the gop offers no proof that the price paid by the obamas was anything other than a matter of negotiation or that the obamas would have had to pay more if not for the rezkos purchase in fact the seller specifically confirmed that the obamas offer of million was the best offer he received on the house further the seller confirmed that he did not offer the obamas a discount on the price of the house on the basis of or in relation to the price offered and accepted on the lot

statement: barack obama has written and co sponsored more bills in three years than hillary clinton has in seven
subject: job-accomplishments
speaker: chain-email
justification: so in an apples to apples comparison of bills written and co sponsored it s clinton obama not quite the conclusion the e mail sought to reach we don t need to rule on whether counting pieces of legislation is a legitimate way of measuring the effectiveness of lawmakers though experts make clear that it s not for us it s enough to look at the facts in the e mail the actual numbers being used to make the comparison and when we look we find manipulation and mistakes

statement: sewer backups into basements caused the vast majority of the damage to homes and buildings in milwaukees july floods but federal flood insurance doesnt cover them
subject: environment
speaker: jim-bohl
justification: nobody has a clear answer on whether sewer backups into basements caused the vast majority of the damage so bohls not all wet but he went a bit overboard

statement: claims ohio gov john kasich says climate change is a problem
subject: climate-change,environment
speaker: florida-wildlife-federation
justification: as long as kasichs comments arent used as a scare tactic to get others to believe in climate change then the governor is ok with how he is being portrayed nichols said and thats how the billboards convey the message just kasich saying he agrees climate change is a problem

statement: americans will pay more in taxes in than they will spend on groceries clothing and shelter combined
subject: economy,taxes
speaker: reince-priebus
justification: foster an economist with the conservative heritage foundation calls the dispute an age old running battle he said the tax foundation is using averages the purpose of averages is to summarize information

statement: i also voted percent of the time with republicans in the oregon legislature
subject: bipartisanship,message-machine-2012,voting-record
speaker: suzanne-bonamici
justification: they also work on many bipartisan issues the closest she comes is a percent match voting record with sen jackie winters over one session

statement: the u s army had a training program that put evangelical christians catholics and mormons in the same category of religious extremism as we do al qaida
subject: military,religion
speaker: randy-forbes
justification: forbes while offering no contrary information made sweeping statements that suggest the training program was widespread and officially sanctioned he also misread one entry on the list as mormons when in fact it named a small sect that practices polygamy

statement: the port provides more than jobs directly to the state of georgia
subject: federal-budget
speaker: johnny-isakson
justification: the senator would have been more accurate if he said port industry or simply said ports isakson underestimated the jobs impact in his argument his estimate was based on a report although the most recent report estimated the total at jobs isaksons remarks were not precise but they are largely on target

statement: the atlanta beltline paid nearly million for less than a quarter acre
subject: government-efficiency
speaker: john-sherman
justification: davidson also argues the project has saved the city money the city initially wanted to use the property as part of a tunnel to manage sewer overflow that atlanta watershed management officials wrote in one document would have cost million the creation of a stormwater retention pond at the park cost less than million city officials say

statement: says leah vukmir supports allowing people to carry concealed weapons into day care centers churches health care clinics and playgrounds
subject: guns,message-machine
speaker: jim-sullivan
context: campaign literature distributed to district residents
justification: in a campaign flier sullivan says vukmir supports allowing people to carry concealed weapons into day cares churches and other places as stated sullivan suggests vukmir wants to allow most anyone to do so in reality the bill in question would have been limited to those who obtained permits and in three of the four public places described applied to a very limited number of people that is an important detail left out

statement: says sen robert cowles her recall opponent supported the sale of state owned power plants not to the highest bidder but to the biggest donors with no oversight

justification: it would have allowed a no bid process for the sale but did not designate any specific buyer beyond that the ad has other problems cowles never even had a chance to vote on the plan in apparently backed taking it out and has a history of opposition to slipping the plan into the budget

statement: west linn has one of the highest per capita rates of home based businesses in the united states
subject: economy

justification: she stood by saying west linn has one of the highest per capita ratings in oregon despite the fact that no one could point to specific data to back that up and we found that no such statistics exist on a city the size of west linn

statement: the new york police department used to have surveillance going on in and around mosques in new york city our mayor totally cut that out
subject: civil-rights,islam,terrorism
speaker: donald-trump
justification: trump said the new york police department used to conduct surveillance in and around mosques in new york city our mayor totally cut that out the program actually went further than just surveilling mosques detectives mapped out entire muslim communities tracked muslims daily activities investigated muslim college students and more the project was shut down but it was the police commissioner not the mayor who officially closed the program the commissioner is the mayors appointee and in all likelihood acted with the mayors approval we cant say with certainty what kind of surveillance the police department conducts now but trump is right that a high profile program was shuttered

statement: says al franken voted to exempt himself and congress from enrolling in the affordable care act marketplaces
subject: health-care,voting-record
speaker: mike-mcfadden
justification: the senator did vote against one amendment however he supported a different amendment that required congress to buy marketplace insurance and he clearly articulated his support for the idea on the senate floor now he s buying his own insurance through the minnesota exchange and voluntarily forgoing a subsidy

statement: youve got almost twice as many cops in new york city as you do on our entire border thats nuts
subject: crime,homeland-security,immigration
speaker: david-dewhurst
justification: those ratios vary widely across the country and even from city to city based on the most recent numbers available new york s ratio in was officers per residents the national rate was its often like comparing apples to carburetors because there is so much difference in how departments use people said craig fraser director of management services for the police executive research forum a nonprofit research and consulting group in washington in some cities police officers do jobs that are performed by civilian personnel elsewhere some police departments have fewer officers because other local law enforcement agencies like a sheriffs office pick up slack it s even trickier to compare agencies with such different duties as the border patrol and the new york police department as dewhurst did so where does all of this leave his statement the lieutenant governor accurately characterizes the relative sizes of two law enforcement agencies the border patrol and the new york police department

statement: under gov bob mcdonnell more jobs have been lost than created in southside and southwest virginia

justification: the only data available at the county level covers nine months of mcdonnells month term but there are other statistics showing that under mcdonnell more people in those regions are employed and the number of job postings have increased correction an earlier version of this story said mcdonnell was sworn in as governor in january

statement: patrick rose voted to explore a state income tax
subject: message-machine,taxes,voting-record

justification: can t get any plainer than that our take isaac would have had a legitimate point if he d limited himself to saying rose voted to study a property tax mechanism that s related to income but his statement grossly overstates things indeed we d suggest if watson s proposal had even been judged the back door to an income tax it would never have drawn legislative backing

statement: the recent process of awarding billion worth of airport vending contracts was the most open and transparent procurement process in the citys history

statement: the ammunition used in the orlando shooting is banned by geneva convention it enters the body spins explodes
subject: guns
speaker: michael-moore
context: a tweet after the Orlando shooting
justification: moore tweeted that the geneva convention prohibits the type of ammunition used in the orlando shooting however the geneva convention does not deal with ammunition other international conventions do prohibit certain ammunition but only during wartime not domestically even if they were binding domestically experts are not sure whether mateens bullets qualify given the limited information released from law enforcement that being said moores tweet does emphasize the amount of damage these bullets inflicted even if his specifics might be off doctors reports support moore on the general point about damages

statement: another one he should veto is the schip program which he should say take the c out of because now it s for everybody like every other entitlement program

justification: if everybody qualified for schip and mccain says there would be no need for private health insurance americans would be taking home more money in their paychecks because they wouldn t have to pay premiums and the federal government would be flat out bankrupt but even in the complex formula for schip eligibility it s easy to dream up an example of someone who wouldn t qualify say a single year old man earning a year the american heritage dictionary defines everybody as every person

statement: russia has an economy the size of italy
subject: economy,foreign-policy
speaker: lindsey-graham
context: comments on CNN's "State of the Union"
justification: graham said russia has an economy the size of italy in terms of nominal gdp graham is correct but if you runthe numbers a different way and measure purchasing power parity russia s economy is larger than italy s graham s statement is accurate but needs additional information

job: Member of the House of Representatinves

statement: in every committee when the health care bill was considered democrats voted against an amendment that would require members of congress and their staff to take the government run public option as their health care plan

statement: the dodd frank financial reform laws hundreds of new rules will force small banks and credit unions to burn up an estimated labor hours just for compliance

justification: the second statistician takes aim and fires six inches too low the two statisticians celebrate and say got him figuring that on average the two shots hit the duck duffys found the trail and is tracking his prey but this is a blind shot at this point

statement: obamas approval numbers are in the low s
subject: pundits,abc-news-week
speaker: matthew-dowd
context: a roundtable discussion on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour''
justification: and among the polls from the month prior to the show the average was once again percent so over the course of the last month obama s approval rating in independent traditional format polls has consistently averaged approximately percent that is in the mid s rather than the low s however the two most recent polls showing obama s approval at percent and percent are smack in the middle of the low s whether these poll results are blips or the start of a new downward trend remains to be seen

statement: the president is brain dead
subject: bush-administration
speaker: joe-biden
justification: it s an extreme charge since brain death is defined as irreversible unconciousness with complete loss of brain function encyclopedia of death and dying we would have accepted the results of a cerebral blood flow study or proof that biden had examined bush to see if he had an oculocephalic reflex

statement: barack obama will somehow manage to add more than trillion to the national debt which is more debt than the presidents who held office before him compiled together
subject: debt,deficit,federal-budget
speaker: jeb-bush
justification: bush said that obama will somehow manage to add more than trillion to the national debt which is more debt than the presidents who held office before him compiled together on the numbers bush is right as long as you measure the nations publicly held debt the most commonly cited statistic and as long as you project forward to the end of obamas tenure but bush leaves out some important context when he focuses the blame solely on obama and when he ignores that the percentage increase in the debt under george w bush was similar

statement: rhode island has the highest percentage of lawyers per capita in the country
subject: legal-issues

statement: i was the first presidential candidate to lay out a specific truly universal health care plan

statement: he voted twice for a budget resolution that increases the taxes on individuals making a year
subject: taxes
speaker: john-mccain

statement: democrats have failed to answer the most basic question of how they want to pay for the more than trillion of health care spending

statement: over the past eight years the united states has reduced our total carbon pollution more than any other nation on earth

speaker: barack-obama
context: the State of the Union address
justification: obama said over the past eight years the united states has reduced our total carbon pollution more than any other nation on earth looked at by the total amount of emission reductions obama is right but when you look at the scale of the cuts proportionately which puts nations on a more equal footing when making comparisons the united states did not achieve the kind of steep cuts that other industrialized countries did

statement: more than half of all black children live in single parent households a number that has doubled doubled since we were children
subject: families
speaker: barack-obama
context: a speech at a Chicago church
justification: but solid research has shown that growing up in a single family household even if other factors are controlled has a negative effect i think there are very few social scientists these days who wouldn t agree that children in single parent households are at risk of a variety of bad outcomes and that family structure has some causal impact on that risk she wrote obama s premise that the absence of fathers is leading to social problems is backed up by research but we re not ruling on that part of his statement

statement: says the democrats told the catholic church that theyll use federal powers to shut down church charities and hospitals if the church doesnt change its beliefs
subject: health-care,religion,sexuality
speaker: ted-cruz
context: a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference
justification: cruz alluding to obamacares contraception insurance coverage mandate said democrats told the catholic church they would use federal powers to shut down its charities and hospitals if the church doesnt change its beliefs we found no sign of such a statement or anything close the catholic bishops have said that potential accumulated fines resulting from refusals to carry out the contraception mandate will cause some institutions to shut down however such prospects do not reflect a direct threat from democrats or the government to the contrary the administration has moved to widen the mandates exemption for religious employers and provide a workaround for those who act as their own insurance providers with the goal of allowing affected parties to continue their work without violating or changing their beliefs

statement: the richest taxpayers are taxed at a lower rate than a a year worker
subject: income,taxes
speaker: sheldon-whitehouse
justification: although irs spokeswoman peggy riley said those taxes are not factored into the irs analysis we understand the point of including them because the social security tax in particular has a significant impact on low and middle income people according to calculations by whitehouses office which match our own when you include social security and medicare taxes the effective tax rate for the wealthiest americans would have been percent in the tax rate for a worker earning a year would have been percent in short whitehouse accurately reported the irs s most recent summary of its top tax filers even if he incorrectly cited the year of the report when we audited his suggestion that the super rich pay a lower rate than someone making just we concluded he s right if you include all payroll taxes but off by about if you only consider income tax as the irs report does

statement: our trade with mexico is million a day thats our no trading partner

justification: van de putte said our trade with mexico is million a day thats our no in mexico was by far the nation with the most trade with texas but texas mexico trade per day added up to million nearly million less than the estimate van de putte drew from a month old presentation by the governors office click here for more on the six politifact ratings and how we select facts to check correction a m june we amended the ruling to make it clear that daily trade in amounted to more than million not annual trade

statement: the health care law is accelerating our country toward bankruptcy

justification: congress would have to act to reduce or eliminate them

justification: schumer said the state department asked all secretaries of state to send their emails over and clinton is the only one whos done it that statement is much more grandiose than the reality of the situation the state department asked four former secretaries of state for any official business conducted on personal emails two of those individuals albright and rice rarely used email at all while in office let alone on a personal account the other powell has said his personal emails no longer exist but said he is working with the state department to recover them if possible correction clinton turned over pages and documents from her private email account

justification: ryan is largely on point if the you refers only to insurance companies but theres nothing in the context to justify such a narrow interpretation wellness programs while not available to everyone are specifically authorized by the affordable care act as a means for employers to raise or lower premiums by up to percent based on employees health related behavior

statement: says unlike tim kaine who investedin education indiana gov mike pence slashed education funding
subject: education,state-budget
speaker: hillary-clinton
context: a campaign rally in Miami, Fla.
justification: clinton said that unlike tim kaine who invested in education in virginia mike pence slashed education funding in indiana the clear implication from clintons statement is that pence cut education in indiana while kaine grew it in virginia pence made various individual cuts and investments in education but overall state spending has increased every year in his term so far kaine made notable investments in certain educational projects as virginias governor but state education spending shrunk overall throughout his term however this was primarily because the recession caused massive budget shortfalls

statement: the federal deficit is growing
subject: deficit,federal-budget
speaker: eric-cantor
justification: cantor said that the federal deficit is growing annual federal deficits are not growing right now and they are not projected to grow through a point at which the deficit will have shrunk by three quarters since however unless policies are changed deficits are projected to grow again in and beyond according to the cbo

statement: obamacare provision will allow forcedhome inspections by government agents
subject: civil-rights,health-care,privacy,public-health
speaker: blog-posting
justification: but the program they pointed to provides grants for voluntary help to at risk families from trained staff like nurses and social workers what bloggers describe would be an egregious abuse of the law not whats allowed by it

statement: throughout we have kept congress fully informed of our efforts to create a legal framework on counterterrorism
subject: legal-issues,terrorism
speaker: barack-obama
context: the State of the Union Address
justification: the white house has certainly provided some information to congress and the public about the process of targeting suspected terrorists and the adversarial relationship between the executive branch almost ensures that not every one of the members of congress will be satisfied with what the executive branch discloses still we think the magnitude of the complaints and the fact that theyre bipartisan suggest that this goes well beyond a small fringe of lawmakers the requests for additional information have been pending for much of the presidents tenure in office a far cry from being transparent throughout his term and a recurring theme of these requests is not that the administration is providing no information but that it is holding back on a portion of the information being sought which is the opposite of keeping congress fully informed

justification: tokaji reached a similar conclusion the bottom line is that in some but not all circumstances a ballot which has both a mark and the name of the candidate written in should be counted which is of course not to say that it will in fact be counted tokaji wrote in an email that some ballots could be counted though is a point of clarification for fudges statement

statement: approximately percent of all college grades today are as an increase of percentage points since

statement: new hampshire is currently the only state in the nation that does not have a full service veterans hospital or equivalent access
subject: veterans
speaker: carol-shea-porter
justification: shea porter wasnt completely right to say new hampshire is the only state without a full service veterans hospital the va doesnt use the definition full service instead it uses the definition of a medical center and alaska doesnt have one either even though it does offer many needed medical services to veterans on base as for equivalent access most new hampshire veterans can access medical centers that will provide the services they need through contracts with non va in state hospitals but in some cases veterans in need of specialized services are sent to boston even when new hampshire veterans are sent out of state they dont have to travel as far as some veterans in larger states like texas shea porters statement leaves out some important details

statement: says rick scotts per pupil education spending is about less than what it was under charlie crist during the recession
subject: education,state-budget
speaker: charlie-crist
context: a "Tampa Bay Times" editorial board interview
justification: crist said scotts per pupil education spending is about less than the crist administration did during the recession scotts current budget does spend almost less per student than crist did in but that was before the recession really hit spending was less during the other three years of crists term although still higher than some of scotts years its worth noting that scott cut school funding when he came into office but has gradually increased it to a level thats currently higher than what crist signed off on during the great recession when you account for inflation though crists per pupil spending outpaces scotts for every year

statement: says sen jeanneshaheens wealth has surged while in public office
subject: congress,income,message-machine-2014,campaign-advertising
speaker: ending-spending-action-fund
justification: by one measure shaheens net worth has actually gone down since she took office though she and her husband have listed more assets investments and financial ventures than in they also have considerably more debt from more mortgages her tax returns filed jointly with her husband have shown wide fluctuations in income since making it hard to discern whether her wealth surged her income was just slightly higher than her average earnings during the past eight years ending spending pointed to a story that has raised questions about the business practices of shaheens husband and their relation to her votes in congress however the findings of the storydont indicate a surge in wealth by the family

statement: a bill to eliminate delta air lines jet fuel tax breaks violates federal law and puts the state at risk of losing critical funding from the federal aviation administration

statement: says he was the only statewide elected official to speak in favor of a federal guest worker plan at the republican party of texas convention

justification: patterson said he was unique among statewide elected officials in speaking for the guest worker section that became part of the republican party of texas platform in

statement: austin mayoral candidate steve adler opposed an injunction to stop a company from dumping petrochemicals directly into the barton springs aquifer
subject: city-government,corrections-and-updates,environment
speaker: brad-rockwell
context: a press conference including mayoral candidate Mike Martinez
justification: rockwell said adler opposed an injunction to stop a company from dumping petrochemicals directly into the barton springs aquifer adler representing lowes in court opposed a successful push by the city of sunset valley and environmental groups to get a temporary injunction to stop lowes from continuing to build a store over the aquifer in a hearing an expert for the plaintiffs testified about observing a hydrocarbon sheen being part of runoff flowing from the site onto underground limestone and significantly the judges order in response said lowes should address any oil spills so adler sought to keep a project going that on the day before the hearing appeared to one engineer to be sending runoff with an oily sheen directly underground however there is vital missing context in that the legal fight wasnt rooted in letting lowes dump or stopping lowes from dumping petrochemicals the big issue was whether the site should be built out with up to percent impervious cover or the percent allowed under the sos ordinance

statement: the florida casino proposed by malaysian gambling conglomerate genting would be nearly double the size of the largest casino in the world

statement: suzanne bonamici votes with her party a partisan percent of the time

statement: since the democrats stimulus went into effect last year ohio has lost about jobs
subject: economy,jobs,stimulus
speaker: rob-portman
justification: portmans campaign later offered the plain dealer conflicting citations for the figures in both statements and for the time frame examined making it difficult to pin down how and when they computed the figure in the end the number of jobs lost cited in portmans june statement is inflated and not close enough to be considered a difference that can be attributed to rounding furthermore while the campaign is correct that jobs have been lost since the stimulus was passed its release ignores important context ohio has started to see net job gains in recent months albeit small contradicting a suggestion that the stimulus bill is causing job losses

statement: the obama administration has put out more of these major rules than the clinton administration or the bush administration during comparable times
subject: market-regulation
speaker: rob-portman
justification: rabinowitz also noted that many regulations grow directly out of laws passed by congress or ordered by courts so presidents are not merely riding roughshod over the will of lawmakers or the public some of obamas biggest rules resulted from court rulings dating to bush with courts requiring environmental regulation after bush balked but obamas share of these or similar statutory or judicially required rules percent of all the rules his administration finalized was not much different from the share clinton had to deal with in his first term nor the share bush had in his second term this doesnt change the facts or statistics as stated by portman the obama administration has put out more of these major rules than the clinton administration or the bush administration during comparable times

statement: says marco rubio sold a home to a chiropractor who had been lobbying him on automobile insurance legislation and once he sold the home for cash the speakers position on the issue changed
subject: ethics
speaker: charlie-crist
context: a Leadership Florida/Florida Press Association debate
justification: this is an interesting case study in politics let s start by stating the obvious rubio would have been better off selling his house to someone other than the mother of a chiropractor who was trying to get him to extend personal injury protection but other than perception there are no obvious glaring red flags about the sale he got a good price it seems but not an outrageous one based on the comparable sales we examined also the cash sale doesn t bother us particularly this is a retiree who had money from a life insurance policy as for rubio s position on the pip laws he initially said he would let the mandate expire unless fraud reforms were included some were included in the legislation proposed by the senate but apparently not enough to sway rubio so the session ended in may without action despite the house sale rubio and house leaders then worked to include additional fraud protections and were able to reach a deal more to their liking rubio in fact called to include pip legislation during a special session the ultimate bill that passed included a few more anti fraud measures but seems not to have stopped much fraud according to state statistics we re not sure why it took five extra months to include the minor changes to the pip legislation or why house leaders didn t propose the changes during the session crist condensed the facts when he said that the chiropractor lobbying rubio bought the house it was the chiropractor s mother who made the purchase he also condensed the timeline and slightly manipulated the chain of events when he said once he sold the home the speaker s position on the issue changed we think there s at least a debate on whether he changed his position at all rubio never said he opposed extending pip he said he opposed extending it without proper protections against fraud a version of the bill proposed during a special legislative session emerged that included fraud protectionshe wanted

statement: on the cuba embargo
subject: foreign-policy
speaker: charlie-crist
justification: while campaigning for governor serving as governor and running for the u s senate crist supported the embargo even once he left the gop he continued to support it though he also agreed with obamas decision to ease travel restrictions but on national tv in crist changed position and said the embargo has failed and that we should get the embargo taken away a poll released days after crists announcement reflects that his new position is in line with the majority of floridians

justification: the kasich campaign ad says that as governor kasich delivered the largest tax cut in the nation while ohios cuts are significant when you factor in state population and economic size kansas reduction may be larger over time ohios shifting of the tax burden from individual income tax to taxation on consumption is what some consider more of a tax shift than a tax cut and forces local governments to raise taxes in turn plus the size of the tax cut wasnt entirely kasichs idea since it was the legislature that made it bigger than he first proposed

statement: barack obama has pledged to reduce the size of the military

justification: increasing our end strength will help units retrain and re equip properly between deployments and decrease the strain on military families the policy also discusses building up special operations forces civil affairs information operations and other units and capabilities that remain in chronic short supply corsi says obama has promised to reduce the size of the military but he seems to be drawing that assumption from obama s criticism of the iraq war and obama s promises to bring more transparency and rigor to the defense contracting process obama s written policy proposals say obama intends to increase the size of the military

statement: says personhood legislation she sponsored would not have restricted access to reproductive services and was simply a statement that i support life

justification: ernst saidpersonhood legislation she sponsored would not have restricted access to reproductive services and was simply a statement that i support life both braley and ernst have exaggerated here ernst has a point that the legislation does not literally call for the restrictions on reproductive rights braley cited but its more than just a statement of principle it would change the iowa constitution in a way that could at some point enable many or all of the consequences braley foresees to be enacted

statement: the republican party fought very hard in the s to get the civil rights bill passed as well as the voting rights bill
subject: civil-rights,elections,history,legal-issues,abc-news-week
speaker: michael-steele
job: chairman of the Republican National Committee
context: an interview on ABC's This Week
justification: and yale university political scientist david mayhew notes that the large republican vote totals for the civil rights act and the voting rights act were not replicated in other key civil rights battles such as an earlier one relating to fair employment practices in and and a subsequent one on fair housing in but on the civil rights act and the voting rights act the most notable factor affecting how republicans voted was pragmatism said bert rockman a political scientist at purdue university the republicans of that era deserve credit lots of it but less in a partisan way than in a now long lost art form forging a consensus around critical national problems back to steele s quote we fought very hard in the s to get the civil rights bill passed as well as the voting rights bill the degree of republican support for the two bills actually exceeded the degree of democratic support and it s also fair to say that republicans took leading roles in both measures even though they had far fewer seats and thus less power at the time

statement: a major part of the climate change bill sponsored by sens john kerry and joe lieberman was essentially written by bp

statement: we ve excluded lobbyists from policymaking jobs

context: his State of the Union address
justification: we do know that mark patterson the chief of staff to treasury secretary tim geithner took one but that information was only released by the white house after lawmakers and media reports started asking questions public records show patterson worked as a lobbyist for goldman sachs in obama said that he has excluded lobbyists from policymaking jobs but that s not the case we know of at least four that have taken on policymaking roles in the obama administration frye s title even contains the word policy

statement: the federal deficit would pay for gallons of new hampshire maple syrup for everyone in the united states
subject: deficit,population,states
speaker: kelly-ayotte
context: a town hall meeting in Colebrook, N.H.
justification: u s sen kelly ayotte said the federal budget deficit is big enough to be able to buy gallons of maple syrup for every resident of the united states ayottes office said she was calculating it based on generic u s made syrup but thats considerably less expensive than new hampshire made syrup if we were buying new hampshire syrup wholesale using prices the amount would come closer but still not hit a full gallons and if we use retail costs in new hampshire it works out to gallons not so her numbers are open to question but her general point is valid either figure represents more than a lifetime supply for the average maple muncher in america

statement: social security and other federal checks may not go out on aug if the debt ceiling is not increased
subject: deficit,federal-budget,social-security
speaker: barack-obama
justification: while it s not a certainty that the obama administration could prioritize cutting checks to seniors there s a reasonable shot that the administration could do it on the other hand doing so would likely cause a lot of collateral damage to other american creditors federal workers students pentagon vendors and countless others and could also hamper the broader economy at a particularly sensitive time the president is probably justified in saying that the possibility of an un raised debt ceiling jeopardizes social security checks after all it hasn t happened before so no one knows for sure but we also think the president probably has tools at his disposal to avoid the worst case scenario for seniors that he expresses concern about
